quotes.author: John Locke

quotes.quote: Your defense will save you on the nights that your offense isn't working.
quotes.author: Adolph Rupp

quotes.quote: The core of our defense is the faith we have in the institutions we defend.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Defense wins championships. A good offense is beat by a good defense, always.
quotes.author: Eric Bolling

quotes.quote: Defense is attack, attack is defense, each being the cause and result of the other.
quotes.author: Bruce Lee

quotes.quote: Self-defense...is the only honourable course where there is unreadiness for self-immolation.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: My philosophy of defense is to keep the pressure on an opponent until you get to his emotions.
quotes.author: John Wooden

quotes.quote: The only defense against evil, violent people is good people who are more skilled at violence.
quotes.author: Rory Miller

quotes.quote: There is no defense against adverse fortune which is so effectual as an habitual sense of humor.
quotes.author: Thomas Wentworth Higginson

quotes.quote: To me, defense is a mental attitude. It takes will and heart to go out there and lock your man up.
quotes.author: Michael Finley

quotes.quote: Defense is the stronger form with the negative object, and attack the weaker form with the positive object.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.quote: Our defense is not in our armaments, nor in science, nor in going underground. Our defense is in law and order.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The problem in defense is how far you can go without destroying from within what you are trying to defend from without.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: Self-defense is not just a set of techniques; it's a state of mind, and it begins with the belief that you are worth defending.
quotes.author: Rorion Gracie

quotes.quote: Truth is the best defense.
quotes.author: Ward Churchill

quotes.quote: Innocence is its own defense.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Defense is superior to opulence.
quotes.author: Adam Smith

quotes.quote: The best defense is not to offend.
quotes.author: Chuck Norris

quotes.quote: The best form of defense is attack.
quotes.author: Carl von Clausewitz

quotes.quote: Self-defense is Nature's eldest law.
quotes.author: John Dryden

quotes.quote: Defense can't guard two things in a row.
quotes.author: Chuck Daly

quotes.quote: Defense is a lot more natural to me than offense.
quotes.author: Scott Rolen

quotes.quote: Self-defense is not only our right; it is our duty.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: Great defense consists of 3 R's: read, react, and rotate.
quotes.author: Peter P. Carr

quotes.quote: The best defense is a well-directed fire from your own guns.
quotes.author: David Farragut

quotes.quote: Any defense of common sense must allow that it is revisable.
quotes.author: Ernest Sosa

quotes.quote: Defense is one man guarding the ball and four others helping him.
quotes.author: Mike Krzyzewski

quotes.quote: Defense doesn't break down on the help, it breaks down on the recovery.
quotes.author: Chuck Daly

quotes.quote: Adequate defense has been the catchword of every militarist for centuries.
quotes.author: Frank B. Kellogg

quotes.quote: Preparation for defense is an inalienable prerogative of a sovereign state.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: The best defense for any group of people is what we do to defend other people.
quotes.author: Russell Simmons

quotes.quote: If you want team play, you must stress defense. Defense makes players unselfish.
quotes.author: John Brady

quotes.quote: The defense of marriage is the defense of freedom. Neither of which is obsolete.
quotes.author: Nancy Pearcey

quotes.quote: Self-defense is the clearest of all laws, and for this reason: lawyers didn't make it.
quotes.author: Douglas William Jerrold

quotes.quote: To those who don't think defense is important, you'll get the best seat on the bench.
quotes.author: Rick Majerus

quotes.quote: The best defense against terrorism is a strong offensive against terrorists. That work continues.
quotes.author: George W. Bush

quotes.quote: Defense is a definite part of the game, and a great part of defense is learning to play it without fouling.
quotes.author: John Wooden

quotes.quote: I believe that the horrifying deterioration in the ethical conduct of people today stems from the mechanization and dehumanization of our lives. A disastrous by-product of the development of the scientific and technical mentality. We are guilty. Man grows cold faster than the planet he inhabits.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The concentration camp is the final expression of human separateness and its ultimate consequence. It is organized abandonment.
quotes.author: Arthur Miller

quotes.quote: If you can laugh with somebody and relate to somebody, it becomes harder to dehumanize them. I think that most of what we are constantly bombarded with in terms of media leads you to a creation of the Other and a dehumanization of the Other, and it's very much an us versus them conversation.
quotes.author: Jehane Noujaim

quotes.quote: Jails and prisons are designed to break human beings, to convert the population into specimens in a zoo. Obedient to our keepers, but dangerous to each other.
quotes.author: Angela Davis

quotes.quote: Our dehumanization of the Negro then is indivisible from our dehumanization of ourselves. The loss of our own identity is the price we pay for our annulment of his.
quotes.author: James A. Baldwin

quotes.quote: To a large extent the evil doers have succeeded in producing at the output end of their machine a kind of black man who is man only in form. This is the extent to which the process of dehumanization has advanced.
quotes.author: Steven Biko

quotes.quote: This self-respect and sense of self-worth, the innermost armament of the soul, lies at the heart of humanness; to be deprived of it is to be dehumanized, to be cleaved from, and cast below, mankind.
quotes.author: Laura Hillenbrand

quotes.quote: When you dehumanize a group, there's lasting consequences because they know that they're being dehumanized.
quotes.author: James Carville

quotes.quote: Communism is the final logic of the dehumanization of man.
quotes.author: Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.quote: Until we learn that other lives are equally grievable and have an equal demand on us to be grieved - especially the ones that we've helped to eliminate - I'm not sure we'll really be on the way to overcoming the problem of dehumanization.
quotes.author: Judith Butler

quotes.quote: Work ends up dehumanizing people.
quotes.author: Pope Francis

quotes.quote: Unless one lives and loves in the trenches, it is difficult to remember that the war against dehumanization is ceaseless.
quotes.author: Audre Lorde

quotes.quote: Dehumanization, although a concrete historical fact, is not a given destiny but the result of an unjust order that engenders violence in the oppressors, which in turn dehumanizes the oppressed.
quotes.author: Paulo Freire

quotes.quote: We have to remember that disagreeing with people is fine; it is dehumanizing people that is not, and when that happens, we have to be ready to speak up.
quotes.author: Pramila Jayapal

quotes.quote: War dehumanizes everyone.
quotes.author: Amanda Lindhout

quotes.quote: It's interesting to see the more femme that you present yourself, the more people sort of dehumanize you.
quotes.author: Justin Tranter

quotes.quote: Whenever you tell a group of people that they can't use bathrooms, or they can't access spaces that other people use, that is dehumanizing. It is discriminatory, and it reinforces the stigma and the prejudices that the transgender community already faces.
quotes.author: Sarah McBride

quotes.quote: Humankind struggles with collective powers for its freedom, the individual struggles with dehumanization for the possession of his soul.
quotes.author: Saul Bellow

quotes.quote: Some of us do talk about women like objects, which dehumanizes them.
quotes.author: John Dickerson

quotes.quote: You don't begin by dehumanizing those who are dehumanizing you, because it contributes to the cycle of dehumanization in the world.
quotes.author: Cornel West

quotes.quote: There's an expression, deja vu, that means that you feel like you've been somewhere before, that you've somehow already dreamed it or experienced it in your mind.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman

quotes.quote: Is déjà vu actually the specter of false timelines that never happened but did, casting their shadows upon reality?
quotes.author: Blake Crouch

quotes.quote: We have all some experience of a feeling, that comes over us occasionally, of what we are saying and doing having been said and done before, in a remote time of our having been surrounded, dim ages ago, by the same faces, objects, and circumstances- of our knowing perfectly what will be said next, as if we suddenly remembered it !
quotes.author: David Copperfield

quotes.quote: Every little job becomes a dream, and you don't recall it anymore, and maybe you might have a deja vu moment, but it's like something you dreamed earlier.
quotes.author: Terrence Howard

quotes.quote: I have gained and lost the same 10 pounds so many times over and over again my cellulite must have deja vu!
quotes.author: Jane Wagner

quotes.quote: Déjà vu is simply remembrance of the future.
quotes.author: Wayne Gerard Trotman

quotes.quote: A déjà vu is your future self doing a past life regression.
quotes.author: David Mellen-Thomas

quotes.quote: Deja Vu confirms a faithful path worth taking.
quotes.author: T. F. Hodge

quotes.quote: Deja Vu is when God thinks something is so funny, that he has to rewind it to show it to his friends.
quotes.author: Unknown Quotes

quotes.quote: I went to a fancy french restaurant called "Deja Vu." The headwaiter said, Don't I know you?
quotes.author: Rod Schmidt

quotes.quote: Let's go back, I know it's been a minute. But I can do it better than I did when I did it. You were loving me, I was loving you. You can come over and we can have deja vu.
quotes.author: Mike Posner

quotes.quote: That was like a carbon copy of the last time we saw them. It was just too much like how it went over at our place to not have a little feeling of déjà vu.
quotes.author: Vic Wolffis

quotes.quote: It's déjà vu all over again. We should have done better. We should have learned from the lessons of the past.
quotes.author: David Walker

quotes.quote: I feel like I've dreamed half of my life that hasn't happened yet, so a lot of times I'm going along, and I do stuff, and I know that I've done it. I have deja vus more than I have regular experiences. If half of your day is a deja vu, then you start to wonder, 'What is real and what isn't?
quotes.author: Marilyn Manson

quotes.quote: I always play every game in my mind before it begins. A lot of times in a game, a play will happen, and it will feel like deja vu, like I've seen the play happen before in my mind.
quotes.author: Troy Aikman

quotes.quote: I haven't been here, but I have been. Can't think of next step, but feels I am pro in this. This makes me wonder, How can I feel the same, when I don't even remember the feeling. What's the logic behind this? What's the connection I feel? Deja vu? Still can't find the answers or solutions, to the situations I feel same.
quotes.author: Sneha Dewani

quotes.quote: Teaching his dad not to stumble while walking, Time reversed their roles. Deja vu moment for a dad as a child's perspective, And for a child as a dad's perspective.
quotes.author: Arunima Sharma

quotes.quote: Something tells me that there will be another Deja vu, but only this time...You'll make it consciously.
quotes.author: Kshama Aghamkar

quotes.quote: We are living in a computer-programmed reality, and the only clue we have to it is when some variable is changed, and some alteration in reality occurs. We have the overwhelming impression that we were reliving the present - deja vu.
quotes.author: Philip K. Dick

quotes.quote: Deja vu - don't know exactly what it is...just a coincidental overlapping of events or a past life experience or something which is beyond our vision..
quotes.author: Deepali Nautiyal

quotes.quote: Usually we find later that we did good. It's all about how things will happen if we allow our own inner to steer, just like wrapping a gift when we realize it's all been Déjà vu.
quotes.author: levi paul taylor

quotes.quote: Beware of that dream, That rivetting Deja vu thing. Some might be astounding and Some creepy and haunting.
quotes.author: SID

quotes.quote: The more I try to Hide my Feelings away...The More My Eyes Show The Urge to Say... I wonder If this is the best Deja vu As I fall in Love with You More and More Everyday.
quotes.author: Barkha Parikh

quotes.quote: Defer no time, delays have dangerous ends.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: You made delay, but time will not, and lost time is never found again.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Delay is hateful, but it gives wisdom.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: Being willing to delay pleasure for a greater result is a sign of maturity.
quotes.author: Dave Ramsey

quotes.quote: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Delay is the deadliest form of denial.
quotes.author: C. Northcote Parkinson

quotes.quote: Delay is a bitter tonic, but it increases appetite.
quotes.author: Austin O'Malley

quotes.quote: Delay in vengeance gives a heavier blow.
quotes.author: John Ford

quotes.quote: Delay is ever fatal to those who are prepared.
quotes.author: Lucan

quotes.quote: When it comes to success, it will come when it comes. A delay does not mean a denial.
quotes.author: Les Brown

quotes.quote: If there is a way to delay an important decision, the good bureaucracy, public or private, will find it.
quotes.author: C. Northcote Parkinson

quotes.quote: Delay is the enemy of progress.
quotes.author: Eliot Spitzer

quotes.quote: Delay always heeds danger.
quotes.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quotes.quote: That delay is our surest protection which enables us to deliberate on the merits of our intentions
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: Never do today what you can put off till tomorrow. Delay may give clearer light as to what is best to be done.
quotes.author: Aaron Burr

quotes.quote: Delay is not a help-mate. The cemetary is full of people who thought they could DO IT tomorrow. Do It Now!
quotes.author: Israelmore Ayivor

quotes.quote: The more circumspectly you delay writing down an idea, the more maturely developed it will be on surrendering itself.
quotes.author: Walter Benjamin

quotes.quote: Where duty is plain, delay is both foolish and hazardous where it is not, delay may provide both wisdom and safety.
quotes.author: Tryon Edwards

quotes.quote: Life goes by rapidly. Don't delay. Don't put it off. Don't wait until you have some spare time. Don't wait until the time's 'right'.
quotes.author: Ken Keyes Jr.

quotes.quote: Delayed gratification is the one thing we ignore these days. And if you delay it, it becomes more pleasurable later in life.
quotes.author: Greg Gutfeld

quotes.quote: The longer you delay, the more your sin gets strength and rooting. If you cannot bend a twig, how will you be able to bend it when it is a tree?
quotes.author: Richard Baxter

quotes.quote: Each indecision brings its own delays and days are lost lamenting over lost days... What you can do or think you can do, begin it. For boldness has magic, power, and genius in it.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Relent not in thy effort to do, when you have to do; for in delay lies mediocrity and in giving up lies perishing; but when the grounds are not ready for landing, hover purposefully.
quotes.author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah

quotes.quote: You should not delay the good things in life. Just do them. Whenever you get a chance to do spiritual practice or seva, don't miss it. Those are the real precious moments of your life.
quotes.author: Sri Sri Ravi Shankar

quotes.quote: Some of our important choices have a time line. If we delay a decision, the opportunity is gone forever. Sometimes our doubts keep us from making a choice that involves change. Thus an opportunity may be missed.
quotes.author: James E. Faust

quotes.quote: The universe likes speed. Don't delay. Don't second guess. Don't doubt. When the opportunity is there, when the impulse is there, when the intuitive nudge from within is there, act. That's your job. That's all you have to do.
quotes.author: Joe Vitale

quotes.quote: Delay is natural to a writer. He is like a surfer-he bides his time, waits for the perfect wave on which to ride in. Delay is instinctive with him. He waits for the surge (of emotion? of strength? of courage?) that will carry him along.
quotes.author: E. B. White

quotes.quote: To delay is injustice.
quotes.author: Jean De La Bruyere

quotes.quote: Delay is preferable to error.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: There is no avoidance in delay.
quotes.author: Aeschylus

quotes.quote: All delays are dangerous in war.
quotes.author: John Dryden

quotes.quote: You can delay but you can't deny.
quotes.author: Tyron Woodley

quotes.quote: One day's delay is another day's lack of progress.
quotes.author: Stuart Bowen

quotes.quote: Let no one delay the study of philosophy while young nor weary of it when old.
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.quote: In a service situation, each delay can mean many unsatisfied customers, each one telling many more.
quotes.author: Ron Kaufman

quotes.quote: If you act anxiously to hasten your results, you delay their arrival. Calm poise reveals the shortest route home.
quotes.author: Alan Cohen

quotes.quote: The hour of reformation is always delayed; every delay gives vice another opportunity of fortifying itself by habit.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: A tragedy can never suffer by delay: a comedy may, because the allusions or the manners represented in it maybe temporary.
quotes.author: Horace Walpole

quotes.quote: The longer incompetent people delay in doing what they`re doing, we`re always better off whenever incompetent people are delaying what they`re going to do.
quotes.author: Lawrence O'Donnell

quotes.quote: The ability to discipline yourself to delay gratification in the short term in order to enjoy greater rewards in the long term, is the indispensable prerequisite for success.
quotes.author: Brian Tracy

quotes.quote: The scriptures make the danger of delay clear. It is that we may discover that we have run out of time. The God who gives us each day as a treasure will require an accounting.
quotes.author: Henry B. Eyring

quotes.quote: You must dare to disassociate yourself from those who would delay your journey... Leave, depart, if not physically, then mentally. Go your own way, quietly, undramatically, and venture toward Trueness at last.
quotes.author: Vernon Howard

quotes.quote: Just as an individual's ability to delay gratification at a young age is a powerful predictor of future academic and professional achievement, discipline is also central to the long-run economic health of nations.
quotes.author: Peter Blair Henry

quotes.quote: People and organizations don't grow much without delegation and completed staff work because they are confined to the capacities of the boss and reflect both personal strengths and weaknesses.
quotes.author: Stephen Covey

quotes.quote: The scholar is the delegated intellect. In the right state he is Man Thinking
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Delegating means letting others become the experts and hence the best.
quotes.author: Timothy Firnstahl

quotes.quote: Don't be a bottleneck. If a matter is not a decision for the President or you, delegate it. Force responsibility down and out. Find problem areas, add structure and delegate. The pressure is to do the reverse. Resist it.
quotes.author: Donald Rumsfeld

quotes.quote: The great leaders are like the best conductors. They reach beyond the notes to reach the magic in the players.
quotes.author: Blaine Lee

quotes.quote: When you delegate tasks, you create followers. When you delegate authority, you create leaders.
quotes.author: Craig Groeschel

quotes.quote: Surround yourself with great people; delegate authority; get out of the way.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: I find that many entrepreneurs are trying to do everything when it would be cheaper and more time-efficient to delegate, even if there are monetary costs associated with that.
quotes.author: James Altucher

quotes.quote: You can delegate authority, but you can never delegate responsibility for delegating a task to someone else. If you picked the right man, fine, but if you picked the wrong man, the responsibility is yours -- not his.
quotes.author: Richard E Krafve

quotes.quote: The really expert riders of horses let the horse know immediately who is in control, but then guide the horse with loose reins and seldom use the spurs.
quotes.author: Sandra Day O'Connor

quotes.quote: Don't tell people how to do things, tell them what to do and let them surprise you with their results.
quotes.author: George S. Patton

quotes.quote: The best executive is the one who has sense enough to pick good men to do what he wants done, and self-restraint to keep from meddling while they do it.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: When you delegate work to the member of the team, your job is to clearly frame success and describe the objectives.
quotes.author: Steven Sinofsky

quotes.quote: The first rule of management is delegation. Don't try and do everything yourself because you can't.
quotes.author: Anthea Turner

quotes.quote: Sometimes you just have to be willing to delegate and not feel like you're the only one with the answer.
quotes.author: Ronald D. Moore

quotes.quote: Delegation is an issue of respect and how much we respect those that are under us on our team.
quotes.author: Dr. Hans Finzel

quotes.quote: Nobody can do everything well, so learn how to delegate responsibility to other winners and then hold them accountable for their decisions.
quotes.author: George Foreman

quotes.quote: You can delegate authority, but you cannot delegate responsibility.
quotes.author: Byron Dorgan

quotes.quote: Are we limiting our success by not mastering the art of delegation? â€¦. it's simply a matter of preparation meeting opportunity.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: The first job of leadership is obtaining power. The second job is delegating it to subordinates.
quotes.author: JBR Yant

quotes.quote: Delegating work works, provided the one delegating works, too.
quotes.author: Robert Half

quotes.quote: DELEGATION, n. In American politics, an article of merchandise that comes in sets.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: The art of delegation is one of the key skills any entrepreneur must master.
quotes.author: Richard Branson

quotes.quote: Hire people who are better than you are, then leave them to get on with it . . . . Look for people who will aim for the remarkable, who will not settle for the routine.
quotes.author: David Ogilvy

quotes.quote: If you want to do a few small things right, do them yourself. If you want to do great things and make a big impact, learn to delegate.
quotes.author: John C. Maxwell

quotes.quote: Every day you meet a delegation going to some convention to try and change the way of somebody else's life.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: Delegation means that he will concern himself with the results of their activities and not with the details of their day-to-day performance. This requires a degree of confidence in them which enables him to accept certain risks. Unless he takes these risks there will be no delegation.
quotes.author: Douglas McGregor

quotes.quote: Many families think of church as if it was a convention - they send one delegate.
quotes.author: Wayne Day

quotes.quote: Imparting trust, the real meaning of delegation, is a powerful thing.
quotes.author: Scott Berkun

quotes.quote: When in doubt, mumble; when in trouble, delegate; when in charge, ponder.
quotes.author: James H. Boren

quotes.quote: Delegation is giving others the opportunity to participate in the story. If you have a good story, people will line up to get involved â€“ to play a part in the story.
quotes.author: Eric Phillips

quotes.quote: Delegation is not a binary thing. There are shades of grey between a dictatorship and an anarchy.
quotes.author: Jurgen Appelo

quotes.quote: Delegation requires the willingness to pay for short term failures in order to gain long term competency.
quotes.author: Dave Ramsey

quotes.quote: As soon as a man climbs up to a high position, he must train his subordinates and trust them. They must relieve him of all small matters. He must be set free to think, to travel, to plan, to see important customers, to make improvements, to do all the big jobs of leadership.
quotes.author: -Herbert N. Casson

quotes.quote: If you don't know what to do with many of the papers piled on your desk, stick a dozen colleagues' initials on them and pass them along. When in doubt, route.
quotes.author: Malcolm S. Forbes

quotes.quote: Once you've identified your crucial tasks and sorted out your priorities, try to find a way to delegate everything else. The inability to delegate is one of the biggest problems I see with managers at all levels.
quotes.author: Eli Broad

quotes.quote: We accomplish all that we do through delegation -- either to time or to other people.
quotes.author: Stephen R. Covey

quotes.quote: Government has no rights; it is a delegation from several individuals for the purpose of securing their own. It is therefore just, only so far as it exists by their consent, useful only so far as it operates to their well-being.
quotes.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quotes.quote: Distinguish between power and control, delegate, be decisive - and always remember people's first names.
quotes.author: Alex Ferguson

quotes.quote: Don’t strive to be a well-rounded leader. Instead, discover your zone and stay there. Then delegate everything else.
quotes.author: Andy Stanley

quotes.quote: As you get bigger, you have to learn to delegate. It's also an excellent way to get staff involved in the company's operations.
quotes.author: Azim Premji

quotes.quote: There is no reason to feel any shame in hiring someone to pick stocks or mutual funds for you. But there's one responsibility that you must never delegate. You, and no one but you, must investigate whether an adviser is trustworthy and charges reasonable fees.
quotes.author: Benjamin Graham

quotes.quote: What really matters in a workplace, what helps an employer if you've got a unionised workforce is if your shop stewards know the rules of the game, if your safety reps are taught to be able to examine situations to make sure the workplace is more safety. Better informed delegates, better workplace safety saves companies money. Unions are very good at safety. We are good at teaching delegates how to resolve disputes.
quotes.author: Bill Shorten

quotes.quote: You can't talk about leadership without talking about responsibility and accountability you can't separate the two. A leader must delegate responsibility and provide the freedom to make decisions, and then be held accountable for the results.
quotes.author: Buck Rodgers

quotes.quote: For He (God) seems to do nothing of himself which He can possibly delegate to His creatures.
quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

quotes.quote: Strategy equals execution. All the great ideas and visions in the world are worthless if they can't be implemented rapidly and efficiently. Good leaders delegate and empower others liberally, but they pay attention to details, every day.
quotes.author: Colin Powell

quotes.quote: The inability to delegate is one of the biggest problems I see with managers at all levels.
quotes.author: Eli Broad

quotes.quote: As all entrepreneurs know, you live and die by your ability to prioritize. You must focus on the most important, mission-critical tasks each day and night, and then share, delegate, delay or skip the rest.
quotes.author: Jessica Jackley

quotes.quote: I don't have a problem with delegation. I love to delegate. I am either lazy enough, or busy enough, or trusting enough, or congenial enough, that the notion leaving tasks in someone else's lap doesn't just sound wise to me, it sounds attractive.
quotes.author: John Ortberg

quotes.quote: It's very important, who has the most delegates. The super delegates should not be the ones making the decision.
quotes.author: Linda Chavez-Thompson

quotes.quote: I do not see a delegation for the four-footed. I see no seat for the eagles. We forget and we consider ourselves superior.
quotes.author: Oren Lyons

quotes.quote: Busy is not a good word, I think. It’s not a good excuse. Get it done; delegate it.
quotes.author: Paul Orfalea

quotes.quote: Systematic decision review also shows executives their own weaknesses, particularly the areas in which they are simply incompetent. In these areas, smart executives don't make decisions or take actions. They delegate.
quotes.author: Peter Drucker

quotes.quote: If you really want to grow as an entrepreneur, you've got to learn to delegate.
quotes.author: Richard Branson.

quotes.quote: The way you delegate is that first you have to hire people that you really have confidence in. You won't truly let those people feel a sense of autonomy if you don't have confidence in them.
quotes.author: Robert Pozen

quotes.quote: The walking delegates of a higher civilization, who have nothing to divide, look upon the notion of property as a purely artificial creation of human society. According to these advanced philosophers, the time will come when no man shall be allowed to call anything his. The beneficent law which takes away an author's rights in his own books just at the period when old age is creeping upon him seems to me a handsome stride toward the longed-for millennium.
quotes.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quotes.quote: But because our organization has grown so much and in so many different ways, the delegation process places responsibility and authority on the shoulders of people you can watch grow and watch the way they treat others.
quotes.author: Vince McMahon

quotes.quote: Do not delegate an assignment and then attempt to manage it yourself  you will make an enemy of the overruled subordinate.
quotes.author: Wess Roberts

quotes.quote: That's Delhi. When life gets too much for you all you need to do is to spend an hour at Nigambodh Ghat, watch the dead being put to flames and hear their kin wail for them. Then come home and down a couple of pegs of whisky. In Delhi, death and drink make life worth living,
quotes.author: Khushwant Singh

quotes.quote: I asked my soul: What is Delhi? She replied: The world is the body and Delhi its life.
quotes.author: Mirza Asadullah Khan Ghalib

quotes.quote: Delhi is not just a national capital, it is one of the political ultimates, one of the prime movers. It was born to power, war and glory. It rose to greatness not because holy men saw visions there but because it commanded the strategic routes from the northwest, where the conquerors came from, into the rich flatlands of the Ganges delta. Delhi is a soldiers' town, a politicians' town, journalists', diplomats' town. It is Asia's Washington, though not so picturesque, and lives by ambition, rivalry and opportunism.
quotes.author: Jan Morris

quotes.quote: Certainly Delhi is unimaginably antique, and age is a metaphysic, I suppose. Illustrations of mortality are inescapable there, and do give the place a sort of nagging symbolism. Tombs of emperors stand beside traffic junctions, forgotten fortresses command suburbs, the titles of lost dynasties are woven into the vernacular, if only as street names.
quotes.author: Jan Morris

quotes.quote: Delhi now belonged to everyone who lived in it. But no one belonged to Delhi.
quotes.author: Anupreeta Das

quotes.quote: Both the heart and Delhi may have been worn out, but some small pleasures still exist in this ruined house.
quotes.author: Mir Taqi Mir

quotes.quote: Delhi. The ruins of an old city, markets, monuments, the zigzag of roads, the still sad times of music past and rising up from it, her mother, wind in her hair, laughing like a witch.
quotes.author: Debotri Dhar

quotes.quote: Delhi alone is a city of love. All those that have passed through have looted it.
quotes.author: Mir Taqi Mir

quotes.quote: June in Delhi illustrates the common belief that a Delhiwala, like a cockroach, can survive anything, for such are the vicissitudes of weather, conditioning and deprivation that the human spirit here has soared to new heights of indomitability to survive.
quotes.author: Namita Gokhale

quotes.quote: It has been said that Delhi is not a city, but a collection of villages... There were Tamil villages, and Gujarati and Kannadiga, and over everything, like a blanket -- like a blankety-blanket -- a vast and spirited Punjabi joy in living that kept the city together and made it one, made it as much as was possible a city.
quotes.author: Vijay Nambisan

quotes.quote: Delhi’s history is etched over its landscape in stone. Magnificent forts, mosques and tombs of the Sultanate and Mughal periods evoke the aura of the medieval world while the stately layout and architecture of Lutyens' Delhi bear the imposing imprint of British imperial rule.
quotes.author: Upinder Singh

quotes.quote: Delhi area has an incredibly long and eventful ancient past, beginning thousands of years ago in the stone age and merging at the other end into the medieval period when the Rajputs made-way for Delhi Sultans in the twelfth century.
quotes.author: Upinder Singh

quotes.quote: Delhi is excellent. Everything looks so beautiful. In Bombay, we don't have such beautiful roads, spacious places, and you cannot have the luxury of having houses and bungalows. You have to live in little pokey flats and cost of living is extremely high in Mumbai. Delhi has a lot that people keep preserving... a lot of which is what Delhi is about.
quotes.author: Bipasha Basu

quotes.quote: In Delhi the cars are getting bigger and sleeker, the hotels are getting posher, the gates are getting higher, and the guards are no longer the old chowkidars, the watchmen, but they are fellows with guns. And yet the poor are packed into every crevice like lice in the city. People don't see that anymore. It's as if you shine a light very brightly in one place, the darkness deepens around.
quotes.author: Arundhati Roy

quotes.quote: Delhi is perhaps the best place to be left a bit undiscovered, to put for later because it will come looking for you, to your city, like a city in love, to ask when you'll coming back. Every visit to Delhi is a reminder for you to visit again, soon.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: We want a good government that works. Let us rise above caste divisions and nepotism and pledge to elect a government that is development oriented. Delhi needs a stable government and a strong government.
quotes.author: Narendra Modi

quotes.quote: Delhi has always been a gateway city, built on the plains, initially on the fording point on the Yamuna River and on the route between western and Central Asia and Southeast Asia. The old empires did not conform to natural boundaries or present-day frontiers, and the limits of the Delhi-centered empire waxed and waned with the power of the ruler.
quotes.author: Patrick Horton

quotes.quote: One evidence of the continuing importance of Delhi, as a location in the third century BC, is the inscription (edict) engraved here on the instruction of the Mauryan emperor Ashoka... the edict is to be found on a rock in the area in modern Kalkaji.
quotes.author: Krishna Menon

quotes.quote: The centuries-old history and culture of India, majestic architectural monuments and museums of Delhi, Agra and Mumbai have a unique attractive force.
quotes.author: Vladimir Putin

quotes.quote: I found that the corridors of power in Delhi were littered with lobbies of various kinds.
quotes.author: Narendra Modi

quotes.quote: Everytime we left our Delhi flat, we'd return home with more questions than answers.
quotes.author: Dave Prager

quotes.quote: Since independence, after the trauma of partition, Delhi now as the national capital has acquired an economic stability, as the seat of the national government, and the home of head offices of both domestic and multinational companies.
quotes.author: Patrick Horton

quotes.quote: Modern Delhi began with the slow revival of the city under British domination. During the ‘Delhi Renaissance’, approximately 1830 to the outbreak of uprising of 1857, Delhi exhibited the beginnings of a cultural ferment; Western technology and idea entered the city and supported each other.
quotes.author: Rakesh Kumar Bhatt

quotes.quote: It's because Gandhi believed in villages and because the British ruled from the cities; therefore, Nehru thought of New Delhi as an un-Indian city.
quotes.author: Nadan Nilekani

quotes.quote: Simplicity is a delicate imposition.
quotes.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: A delicate thought is a flower of the mind.
quotes.author: Charles Rollin

quotes.quote: Meditation is the delicate art of doing nothing.
quotes.author: Sri Sri Ravi Shankar

quotes.quote: Delicate humor is the crowning virtue of the saints.
quotes.author: Evelyn Underhill

quotes.quote: Mind is a most delicate evidence. Not a soul has seen it yet.
quotes.author: Richard Eberhart

quotes.quote: The delicate balance between modesty and conceit is popularity.
quotes.author: Max Beerbohm

quotes.quote: Fine and delicate taste is the fruit of education and experience.
quotes.author: Jean-Auguste-Dominique Ingres

quotes.quote: Many things are too delicate to be thought; many more, to be spoken.
quotes.author: Novalis

quotes.quote: The imagination is of so delicate a texture that even words wound it.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.quote: Pride is seldom delicate: it will please itself with very mean advantages.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: To dispense with ceremony is the most delicate mode of conferring a compliment.
quotes.author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quotes.quote: The point of life is to find the delicate equilibrium between dream and reality.
quotes.author: Lillian Smith

quotes.quote: Food's delicate. You have to handle it with finesse. You can't just be a big ogre.
quotes.author: April Bloomfield

quotes.quote: When you see how fragile and delicate life can be, all else fades into the background.
quotes.author: Jenna Morasca

quotes.quote: A beginning is the time for taking the most delicate care that the balances are correct.
quotes.author: Frank Herbert

quotes.quote: Writing is the delicate, difficult, and dangerous means of succeeding in avowing the unavowable.
quotes.author: Hélène Cixous

quotes.quote: Even dreams, the most delicate and intangible of things, can prove remarkable difficult to kill.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman

quotes.quote: The more delicate and ambitious the soul, the further do dreams estrange it from possible things.
quotes.author: Charles Baudelaire

quotes.quote: I'll have you know that the most delicate flowers often produce the strongest scent when crushed.
quotes.author: Maria V. Snyder

quotes.quote: There is always a very delicate interplay between individual actions and institutional conditions.
quotes.author: Cornel West

quotes.quote: You have to be delicate with how you can portray characters other people are having a worship over.
quotes.author: Richard Madden

quotes.quote: Success is the result of a delicate balance between making things happen and letting things happen.
quotes.author: Robin Sharma

quotes.quote: Our taste is too delicate and particular. It says nay to the poet's work, but never yea to his hope.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: The most delicate, the most sensible of all pleasures, consists in promoting the pleasure of others.
quotes.author: Jean De La Bruyere

quotes.quote: It is a very delicate job to forgive a man, without lowering him in his own estimation, and yours too.
quotes.author: Josh Billings

quotes.quote: The reactions of the human heart are not mechanical and predictable but infinitely subtle and delicate.
quotes.author: Daisaku Ikeda

quotes.quote: Since love is the most delicate and total act of a soul, it will reflect the state and nature of the soul.
quotes.author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset

quotes.quote: Some delicate matters must be treated like pins, because if they are not seized by the right end, we get pricked.
quotes.author: Jean Antoine Petit-Senn

quotes.quote: The delicate and infirm go for sympathy, not to the well and buoyant, but to those who have suffered like themselves.
quotes.author: Catharine Beecher

quotes.quote: We have learned to express the more delicate nuances of feeling by penetrating more deeply into the mysteries of harmony.
quotes.author: Robert Schumann

quotes.quote: Nothing is so delicate as the reputation of a woman; it is at once the most beautiful and most brittle of all human things.
quotes.author: Frances Burney

quotes.quote: Friends should be very delicate and careful in administering pity as medicine, when enemies use the same article as poison.
quotes.author: John Frederick Boyes

quotes.quote: Women are delicate creatures. Fragile. Gentle. Made by God to be sheltered from the harshness of this world. *- Morgan MacDonnell
quotes.author: Teresa Medeiros

quotes.quote: The voice of conscience is so delicate that it is easy to stifle it; but it is also so clear that it is impossible to mistake it.
quotes.author: Madame De Stael

quotes.quote: The delicate balance of mentoring someone is not creating them in your own image, but giving them the opportunity to create themselves.
quotes.author: Steven Spielberg

quotes.quote: The human heart is so delicate and sensitive that it always needs some tangible encouragement to prevent it from faltering in its labour.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.quote: Trust is a delicate idea, held up by time and togetherness. But one person slips and the whole thing shatters. Like glass. and young girls' hearts.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: A new idea is delicate. It can be killed by a sneer or a yawn; it can be stabbed to death by a quip and worried to death by a frown on the right man's brow.
quotes.author: Ovid

quotes.quote: Be as delicate as possible. If communication accomplishes something on the gross but damages something on the level of feeling then it is a spiritual loss! The feeling is more important for life.
quotes.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi

quotes.quote: The commonest thing is delightful if one only hides it.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: The most delightful pleasures cloy without variety.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: It is a beautiful and delightful sight to behold the body of the Moon.
quotes.author: Ptolemy

quotes.quote: The most delightful surprise in life is to suddenly recognise your own worth.
quotes.author: Maxwell Maltz

quotes.quote: There is always something particularly delightful about exceptions to a rule.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Goudge

quotes.quote: If nothing is delightful without love and jokes, then live in love and jokes.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.quote: How delightful to find a friend in everyone.
quotes.author: Joseph Brodsky

quotes.quote: One of the delightful things about Americans is that they have absolutely no historical memory.
quotes.author: Zhou Enlai

quotes.quote: It is delightful to kiss the eyelashes of the beloved--is it not? But never so delightful as when fresh tears are on them.
quotes.author: Walter Savage Landor

quotes.quote: How delightful it is to see a friend after a length of absence! How delightful to chide him for that length of absence to which we owe such delight.
quotes.author: Walter Savage Landor

quotes.quote: How delightful it would be to love if one loved always! But alas! There are no eternal loves.
quotes.author: George De Scuderi

quotes.quote: What a delightful thing is the conversation of specialists! One understands absolutely nothing and it's charming.
quotes.author: Edgar Degas

quotes.quote: There is no more delightful hour in life than that of an unconfessed but mutual love.
quotes.author: Eliza Lynn Linton

quotes.quote: It is always delightful when a great and beautiful idea proves to be consonant with reality.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: It is delightful some times to sit with an ingenious friend, He understands you before you having said anything.
quotes.author: Muhammad Atta-ullah Faizani

quotes.quote: Oh, my young friends, how delightful is the beginning of a love-business, and how undignified, sometimes, the end!
quotes.author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quotes.quote: It is delightful to transport one's self into the spirit of the past, to see how a wise man has thought before us
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Perhaps the most delightful friendships are those in which there is much agreement, much disputation, and yet more personal liking.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: And, by the way, one of the most delightful things I find in America is meeting a people without prejudice -- everywhere open to the truth.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: The most delightful aspect about the language of cinema is that it speaks to each of us in different ways - it is a purely subjective experience.
quotes.author: Tina Ambani

quotes.quote: It is the most delightful thing that ever happens to me, when I hear something coming out of my guitar and out of my mouth that wasn't there before.
quotes.author: James Taylor

quotes.quote: How delightful is the company of generous people, who overlook trifles and keep their minds instinctively fixed on whatever is good and positive in the world around them.
quotes.author: Van Wyck Brooks

quotes.quote: We have had an unspeakably delightful journey, one of those journeys which seem to divide one's life in two, by the new ideas they suggest and the new views of interest they open.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: I just think it is so delightful to see people, let their elbows free. I think the exuberance of it all is really exciting to me. It's a signal of the abundance of diversity and creative expression.
quotes.author: William McDonough

quotes.quote: It is a most delightful reflection that if I come to the throne of God in prayer, I may feel a thousand defects, but yet there is hope. I usually feel more dissatisfied with my prayers than with anything else I do.
quotes.author: Charles Spurgeon

quotes.quote: Oh, it's delightful to have ambitions. I'm so glad I have such a lot. And there never seems to be any end to them-- that's the best of it. Just as soon as you attain to one ambition you see another one glittering higher up still. It does make life so interesting.
quotes.author: Lucy Maud Montgomery

quotes.quote: All that is sweet, delightful, and amiable in this world, in the serenity of the air, the fineness of seasons, the joy of light, the melody of sounds, the beauty of colors, the fragrancy of smells, the splendor of precious stones, is nothing else but Heaven breaking through the veil of this world.
quotes.author: William Law

quotes.quote: There is nothing more delightful than to scoop up a wild joey in your arms and smell the wind and eucalyptus in the coats of the gentle kangaroo or the deep-earth smell of tiny wallabies. It is wonderful to see the trust in their eyes and the gradual realization that you mean them no harm.
quotes.author: Stella Reid

quotes.quote: It is delightful to read on the spot the impressions and opinions of tourists who visited a hundred years ago, in the vehicles and with the aesthetic prejudices of the period, the places which you are visiting now. The voyage ceases to be a mere tour through space; you travel through time and thought as well.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: There is always a delightful sense of movement, vibration and life.
quotes.author: Theodore Robinson

quotes.quote: It is delightful to play the fool.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.quote: It's delightful when your imaginations come true, isn't it?
quotes.author: Lucy Maud Montgomery

quotes.quote: All that in this delightful garden grows should happy be and have immortal bliss.
quotes.author: Edmund Spenser

quotes.quote: What makes us human is what is delightful.
quotes.author: Genevieve Bell

quotes.quote: But it is a delightful challenge to try to depict interesting aliens.
quotes.author: David Brin

quotes.quote: Few things are more delightful than grandchildren fighting over your lap.
quotes.author: Doug Larson

quotes.quote: There's something that's delightful about things getting bigger and more over-the-top. Sometimes it's empty, and other times, it's just fun.
quotes.author: Christopher Miller

quotes.quote: What are more delightful than one's emotions when approaching a trout stream for the initial cast?
quotes.author: Nash Buckingham

quotes.quote: It is so delightful to teach those one loves!
quotes.author: Andrew Lang

quotes.quote: It's a delightful thing to receive a good word just at your time of need. Encourage someone today.
quotes.author: Charles R. Swindoll

quotes.quote: It is a regrettable, but undeniable, fact that the most delightful people are seldom big money-makers.
quotes.author: Marjorie Hillis

quotes.quote: I always think that the most delightful thing about traveling is to always be running into Americans and to always feel at home.
quotes.author: Anita Loos

quotes.quote: A delightful form of government, anarchic and motley, assigning a kind of equality indiscriminately to equals and unequals alike!
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: How innocent, how happy, how truly delightful, even, would life be if we were to desire nothing but what is to be found upon the face of the earth: in a word, nothing but what is provided ready to our hands!
quotes.author: Pliny the Elder

quotes.quote: It seems to me that the most delightful walk of life is to be found in a household of moderate means, to live there with an obliging spouse and to be satisfied with little.
quotes.author: Martin Luther

quotes.quote: What more delightful avocation than to take a piece of land and by cautious experimentation to prove how it works. What more substantial service to conservation than to practice it on one's own land?
quotes.author: Aldo Leopold

quotes.quote: The delightful study of the Psalms has yielded me boundless profit and ever-growing pleasure; common gratitude constrains me to communicate to others a portion of the benefit, with the prayer that it may induce them to search further for themselves.
quotes.author: Charles Spurgeon

quotes.quote: How delightful are the pleasures of the imagination! In those delectable moments, the whole world is ours; not a single creature resists us, we devastate the world, we repopulate it with new objects which, in turn, we immolate. The means to every crime is ours, and we employ them all, we multiply the horror a hundredfold.
quotes.author: Marquis De Sade

quotes.quote: In a delightful garden, sowing, planting or digging are not hardship but are done with a zeal and a certain pleasure.
quotes.author: Martin Luther

quotes.quote: Life is too short to have anything but delusional notions about yourself.
quotes.author: Gene Simmons

quotes.quote: The delusional is no longer marginal.
quotes.author: BILL MOYERS

quotes.quote: All are lunatics, but he who can analyze his delusions is called a philosopher.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: Delusional people tend to believe in what they're doing.
quotes.author: Brent Weeks

quotes.quote: No man is happy without a delusion of some kind. Delusions are as necessary to our happiness as realities.
quotes.author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quotes.quote: There's a certain delusional quality that all successful people have to have.
quotes.author: Will Smith

quotes.quote: Delusion detests focus and romance provides the veil.
quotes.author: Suzanne Finnamore

quotes.quote: The end of an delusion is invariably sadness or tears
quotes.author: Pop Samuel

quotes.quote: Today's truth will be tomorrow's lie and you will be left questioning your own sanity.
quotes.author: Michael R. Fletcher

quotes.quote: Getting rid of a delusion makes us wiser than getting hold of a truth.
quotes.author: Ludwig Borne

quotes.quote: It is a common delusion that you make things better by talking about them.
quotes.author: Rose Macaulay

quotes.quote: No delusion is greater than the notion that method and industry can make up for lack of mother-wit, either in science or in practical life.
quotes.author: Thomas Huxley

quotes.quote: The worst deluded are the self-deluded.
quotes.author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quotes.quote: Let no man in the world live in delusion. Without a Guru none can cross over to the other shore.
quotes.author: Guru Nanak

quotes.quote: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.
quotes.author: Leo Nikolaevich Tolstoy

quotes.quote: The fundamental delusion of humanity is to suppose that I am here and you are out there
quotes.author: Yasutani Roshi

quotes.quote: Delusion arises from anger. The mind is bewildered by delusion. Reasoning is destroyed when the mind is bewildered. One falls down when reasoning is destroyed.
quotes.author: Bhagavad Gita

quotes.quote: Self-delusion is pulling in your stomach when you step on the scales
quotes.author: Paul Sweeney

quotes.quote: A delusion is something that people believe in despite a total lack of evidence.
quotes.author: Richard Dawkins

quotes.quote: The people never give up their liberties but under some delusion.
quotes.author: Edmund Burke

quotes.quote: The great thing about a culture of givers is that's not a delusion - it's reality.
quotes.author: Adam Grant

quotes.quote: The delusion of entertainment is devoid of meaning. It may amuse us for a bit, but after the initial hit we are left with the dark feeling of desolation.
quotes.author: Arthur Erickson

quotes.quote: One of the greatest delusions in the world is the hope that the evils in this world are to be cured by legislation.
quotes.author: Thomas Reed

quotes.quote: I'm so incredibly tired of giving respect to a lot of delusions and crazy ideas just because they are regarded as religions.
quotes.author: Bjorn Ulvaeus

quotes.quote: The disappointment of manhood succeeds the delusion of youth.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: The house of delusions is cheap to build but drafty to live in.
quotes.author: A. E. Housman

quotes.quote: A dream with courage is innovation...A dream without courage is a delusion
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Delusions, carefully implanted, are difficult to correct.
quotes.author: Joost A.M. Meerloo

quotes.quote: No one who shares a delusion ever recognizes it as such.
quotes.author: Sigmund Freud

quotes.quote: Artists are not in delusion, they only recreate the hidden side
quotes.author: Farid F. Ibrahim

quotes.quote: The only thing that makes life unfair is the delusion that it should be fair.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: Reality is a hallucination shared by most sane men.
quotes.author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quotes.quote: We live and we die and anything else is just a delusion.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.quote: Sin is the delusion of our feelings; while crime is the delusion of our actions.
quotes.author: M.F. Moonzajer

quotes.quote: The possibility of truth has become a delusion to those who made their own disguise the truth.
quotes.author: Nema Al-Araby

quotes.quote: In an era of stress and anxiety, when the present seems unstable and the future unlikely, the natural response is to retreat and withdraw from reality, taking recourse either in fantasies of the future or in modified visions of a half-imagined past.
quotes.author: Alan Moore

quotes.quote: It seems sometimes that people take a deliberately myopic and fill their eyes with things seen microscopically in order not to see macroscopically.
quotes.author: Marilyn Frye

quotes.quote: The belief that one's own view of reality is the only reality is the most dangerous of all delusions.
quotes.author: Paul Watzlawick

quotes.quote: The sense that my world is stable and stationary, that change will never come and that all will go on continuously as it is, is the nature of all delusion.
quotes.author: Brenda Shoshanna

quotes.quote: A person experiences life as something separated from the rest - a kind of optical delusion of consciousness. Our task must be to free ourselves from this self-imposed prison, and through compassion, to find the reality of Oneness.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: When a society is stressed, when it comes up against things that are hard to understand, you get a lot of delusional thinking.
quotes.author: James Howard Kunstler

quotes.quote: Delusional pain hurts just as much as pain from actual trauma. So what if it's all in your head?
quotes.author: Octavia E. Butler

quotes.quote: Delusional or not, maybe if I believe in a better world with enough conviction, and convince others to believe it as well, then it will be real.
quotes.author: Emilyann Girdner

quotes.quote: Dictating to dictators doesn't work; they are congenitally delusional about their own indispensability.
quotes.author: Joe Klein

quotes.quote: If you are delusional, sometimes the reality catches up with your delusion, and then all of a sudden you are a genius.
quotes.author: Jason Calacanis

quotes.quote: Delusions are commonly defined as fixed, false beliefs held with certainty and not in keeping with usual social and cultural context.
quotes.author: S. A.

quotes.quote: To many mental health professionals, delusional disorder remains a shadowy concept and it is quite possible for a psychiatrist to have a busy practice and either not see, or not recognize, cases of the illness.
quotes.author: Alistair Munro

quotes.quote: Who is it that affirms most boldly? Who is it that holds his opinion most obstinately? Ever they who hath most ignorance; for they also have most pride.
quotes.author: Khemetic Saying

quotes.quote: Beware that you do not lose the substance by grasping at the shadow.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.quote: The worst of all deceptions is self-deception.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: Nothing is so easy as to deceive one's self, for what we wish to believe, we readily believe, but such expectations are often inconsistent with the real state of things.
quotes.author: Demosthenes

quotes.quote: No one was ever injured by the truth. But a man injures himself if he lives with self-deception and ignorance.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The awareness of mortals falls short. As long as they're attached to appearances, they're unaware that their mind is empty. And by mistakenly clinging to the appearance of things, they lose the Way.
quotes.author: Bodhidharma

quotes.quote: Like an image in a dream the world is troubled by love, hatred, and other poisons. So long as the dream lasts, the image appears to be real; but on awaking it vanishes.
quotes.author: Shankara

quotes.quote: Delusion completely overcomes man's sense of right and wrong.
quotes.author: Srimad Bhagavatam

quotes.quote: It's this false thinking that block him / From the path that leads to himself. / By always saying, "Further on!" / He's become estranged from "here": / Because of a false fantasy / He's driven from reality.
quotes.author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quotes.quote: A man must be both stupid and uncharitable who believes there is no virtue or truth but on his own side.
quotes.author: Joseph Addison

quotes.quote: There is no end to illusion. Life is a train of moods like a string of beads, and as we pass through them they prove to be many colored lenses which paint the world their own hue.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: But do not distress yourself with imaginings. Many fears are born of fatigue and loneliness.
quotes.author: Max Ehrmann

quotes.quote: If you do not raise your eyes you will think you are the highest point.
quotes.author: Antonio Porchia

quotes.quote: Each thing we see hides something else we want to see.
quotes.author: Rene Magritte

quotes.quote: Our greatest illusion is disillusion. We imagine that we are disillusioned with life, when the truth is that we have not even begun to live.
quotes.author: Paul Brunton

quotes.quote: There is a condition worse than blindness, and that is seeing something that isn't there.
quotes.author: L. Ron Hubbard

quotes.quote: Nobody is more dangerous than he who imagines himself pure in heart, for his purity, by definition, is unassailable.
quotes.author: James Baldwin

quotes.quote: Human beings seem to have an almost unlimited capacity to deceive themselves and to deceive themselves into taking their own lies for truth.
quotes.author: R. D. Laing

quotes.quote: Life is winging it. To suggest otherwise is delusional.
quotes.author: Tom Peters

quotes.quote: Delusional romantic attachments. Often associated with an excessive intrusiveness into the life of the object of the irrational affection. Stalking, if you like.
quotes.author: Dr. Martin Ellingham

quotes.quote: Those with dementia are still people and they still have stories and they still have character and they're all individuals and they're all unique. And they just need to be interacted with on a human level.
quotes.author: Carey Mulligan

quotes.quote: That's the thing with dementia. If you're with somebody who has a serious illness, you can usually talk to them, have a laugh every now and then - the person is still with you. With dementia, there's no conversation; there's no togetherness, no sharing.
quotes.author: Judy Parfitt

quotes.quote: None of us wants to be reminded that dementia is random, relentless, and frighteningly common.
quotes.author: Laurie Graham

quotes.quote: Dementia is quite unlike cancer or heart disease or any of those other conditions where you bargain with God for a cure or even just a bit more time.
quotes.author: Laurie Graham

quotes.quote: Dementia resembles delirium in the same way an ultra-marathon resembles a dash across the street. Same basic components, vastly different scale. If you've run delirium's course once or twice in your life, try to imagine a version that never ends.
quotes.author: Floyd Skloot

quotes.quote: When you deal with a person who's experiencing dementia, you can see where they're struggling with knowledge. You can see what they forget completely, what they forget but they know what they once knew. You can tell how they're trying to remember.
quotes.author: Walter Mosley

quotes.quote: Dementia was like a truth serum.
quotes.author: Amy Tan

quotes.quote: A lot of people have dementia, which is great, because then they don't recognize me.
quotes.author: Erykah Badu

quotes.quote: The terror dementia sufferers must feel is unimaginable, but the techniques they use to hide their difficulties - the ducking and diving and keeping the world laughing - are perfectly understandable.
quotes.author: Laurie Graham

quotes.quote: While no one can change the outcome of dementia or Alzheimer's, with the right support you can change the journey.
quotes.author: Tara Reed

quotes.quote: Was the dementia of old age a blessing in disguise? No more thoughts. No more damage inflicted. No more memories of damage survived.
quotes.author: Janet Turpin Myers

quotes.quote: We can alleviate physical pain, but mental pain - grief, despair, depression, dementia - is less accessible to treatment. It's connected to who we are - our personality, our character, our soul, if you like.
quotes.author: Richard Eyre

quotes.quote: Dementia is our most-feared illness, more than heart disease or cancer.
quotes.author: David Perlmutter

quotes.quote: Dementia is, after all, a symptom of organic brain damage. It is a condition, a disorder of the central nervous system, brought about in my case by a viral assault on brain tissue. When the assault wiped out certain intellectual processes, it also affected emotional processes.
quotes.author: Floyd Skloot

quotes.quote: Dementia is not exclusively a problem of the developed world.
quotes.author: Julie Bishop

quotes.quote: Let's not let our fear of dementia deepen our fear of dementia.
quotes.author: Bill Crawford

quotes.quote: Democracy is the worst form of government except all those other forms that have been tried from time to time.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Democracy is two wolves and a lamb voting on what to have for lunch. Liberty is a well-armed lamb contesting the vote!
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Democracy works when people claim it as their own.
quotes.author: BILL MOYERS

quotes.quote: Democracy consists of choosing your dictators, after they've told you what you think it is you want to hear.
quotes.author: ALAN COREN

quotes.quote: Democracy is the recurrent suspicion that more than half of the people are right more than half the time.
quotes.author: E.B. WHITE

quotes.quote: Democracy is a pathetic belief in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.
quotes.author: Henry Louis Mencken

quotes.quote: Democracy is when the indigent, and not the men of property, are the rulers.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Democracy is a charming form of government, full of variety and disorder, and dispensing a sort of equality to equals and unequal alike.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: Democracy is the art and science of running the circus from the monkey cage.
quotes.author: Henry Louis Mencken

quotes.quote: Democracy, like liberty, justice and other social and political rights are not given. They are earned through courage, resolution and sacrifice.
quotes.author: Aung San Suu Kyi

quotes.quote: Democracy is the process by which people choose the man who'll get the blame.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Democracy is the form of government that gives every man the right to be his own oppressor.
quotes.author: James Russell Lowell

quotes.quote: Democracy is the art of thinking independently together.
quotes.author: Alexander Meiklejohn

quotes.quote: A democracy is a volcano which conceals the fiery materials of its own destruction. These will produce an eruption and carry desolation in their way.
quotes.author: Fisher Ames

quotes.quote: Democracy means government by discussion, but it is only effective if you can stop people talking.
quotes.author: Clement Atlee

quotes.quote: Democracy means not 'I am as good as you are' but 'You are as good as I am.
quotes.author: Theodore Parker

quotes.quote: Democracy does not guarantee equality of conditions - it only guarantees equality of opportunity.
quotes.author: Irving Kristol

quotes.quote: Democracy is 51% of the people taking away the rights of the other 49%.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Democracy is like a hobby horse: It will carry you nowhere unless you use your own legs.
quotes.author: Herbert Samuel

quotes.quote: Democracy is not a fragile flower; still it needs cultivating.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: Democracy means that anyone can grow up to be president, and anyone who doesn't grow up can be vice president.
quotes.author: Johnny Carson

quotes.quote: The ship of democracy, which has weathered all storms, may sink through the mutiny of those on board.
quotes.author: Grover Cleveland

quotes.quote: Democracy is based upon the conviction that there are extraordinary possibilities in ordinary people.
quotes.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quotes.quote: Democracy is a device that ensures we shall be governed no better than we deserve.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Democracy substitutes election by the incompetent many for appointment by the corrupt few.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Democracy: The state of affairs in which you consent to having your pocket picked, and elect the best man to do it.
quotes.author: Benjamin Lichtenberg

quotes.quote: Democracy is like a raft: It won't sink, but you will always have your feet wet.
quotes.author: Russell B. Long

quotes.quote: Democracy cannot flourish half rich and half poor, any more than it can flourish half free and half slave.
quotes.author: Felix G. Rohatyn

quotes.quote: Democracy is an experiment, and the right of the majority to rule is no more inherent than the right of the minority to rule; and unless the majority represents sane, righteous, unselfish public sentiment, it has no inherent right.
quotes.author: William Allen White

quotes.quote: The primal principle of democracy is the worth and dignity of the individual.
quotes.author: Edward Bellamy

quotes.quote: Democracy is not the law of the majority but the protection of the minority.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: In a democracy, the individual enjoys not only the ultimate power but carries the ultimate responsibility.
quotes.author: Norman Cousins

quotes.quote: I understand democracy as something that gives the weak the same chance as the strong.
quotes.author: Mohandas K. Gandhi

quotes.quote: A great democracy must be progressive or it will soon cease to be a great democracy.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Democracy is constructed like an edifice, freedom by freedom, right by right, until it reaches its snapping point.
quotes.author: Abdoulaye Wade

quotes.quote: The whole purpose of democracy is that we may hold counsel with one another, so as not to depend upon the understanding of one man.
quotes.author: Woodrow Wilson

quotes.quote: In our so-called democracy we are accustomed to give the majority what they want rather than educate them to understand what is best for them.
quotes.author: Carter Woodson

quotes.quote: Democracy is the government of the people, by the people, for the people.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Democracy is the most demanding of all forms of government in terms of the energy, imagination, and public spirit required of the individual.
quotes.author: George C. Marshall

quotes.quote: Democracy cannot succeed unless those who express their choice are prepared to choose wisely. The real safeguard of democracy, therefore, is education.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Democracy is supposed to give you a feeling of choice, like painkiller x and painkiller y. But they're both just aspirin.
quotes.author: Gore Vidal

quotes.quote: Adultery is the application of democracy to love.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: Democracy is only an experiment in government, and it as the obvious disadvantage of merely counting votes instead of weighing them.
quotes.author: Dean Inge

quotes.quote: Democracy is an abuse of statistics.
quotes.author: Jorge Luis Borges

quotes.quote: The great thing about democracy is that it gives every voter a chance to do something stupid.
quotes.author: Art Spander

quotes.quote: Democracy encourages the majority to decide things about which the majority is ignorant.
quotes.author: John Simon

quotes.quote: Democracy is a pathetic belief in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.
quotes.author: H.L. Mencken

quotes.quote: Democracy is worth dying for, because it's the most deeply honorable form of government ever devised by man.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: Democracy is the power of equal votes for unequal minds.
quotes.author: Charles I of England

quotes.quote: Democracy has nothing to do with freedom. Democracy is a soft variant of communism, and rarely in the history of ideas has it been taken for anything else.
quotes.author: Hans-Hermann Hoppe

quotes.quote: Democracy demands that the religiously motivated translate their concerns into universal, rather than religion-specific, values.
quotes.author: Barrack Obama

quotes.quote: If one man offers you democracy and another offers you a bag of grain, at what stage of starvation will you prefer the grain to vote?
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Democracy reads well, but it doesn't act well.
quotes.author: Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Representative government should be something for us to support rather than something to support us.
quotes.author: Irvin S. Cobb

quotes.quote: We adore titles and heredities in our hearts and ridicule them with our hearts and ridicule them with our mouths; this is our democratic privilege.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Democracy is the theory that the common people know what they want, and deserve to get it good and hard.
quotes.author: Mencken

quotes.quote: A fanatical belief in democracy makes democratic institutions impossible.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: If you want to understand democracy, spend less time in the library with Plato, and more time in the buses with people.
quotes.author: Simeon Strunsky

quotes.quote: Democracy is ever eager for rapid progress, and the only progress which can be rapid is progress downhill.
quotes.author: James Jeans

quotes.quote: Democracy is a word all public men use and none understand.
quotes.author: Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: The doctrine that the cure for the evils of democracy is more democracy is like saying that the cure of crime is more crime.
quotes.author: Mencken

quotes.quote: Democracy is the hole in the stuffed shirt through which the sawdust slowly trickles.
quotes.author: E.B. White

quotes.quote: A democracy is a government in the hands of men of low birth, no property, and unskilled labor.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Democracy is the last refuge of cheap misgovernment.
quotes.author: Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Democracy is a form of government where you can always say what you like, and do what you're told.
quotes.author: Evan Esar

quotes.quote: Government of the people and for the people never seems to get along with the people.
quotes.author: Evan Esar

quotes.quote: Democracy is a ship of state whose officers try to steer a straight course in all directions.
quotes.author: Evan Esar

quotes.quote: The virtue of a free government is that the more freedom you have, the less government you need to have.
quotes.author: Evan Esar

quotes.quote: Democracy is a form of government whose citizens have complete freedom to choose which candidate they prefer to mess things up for them.
quotes.author: Evan Esar

quotes.quote: Democracy is being allowed to vote for the candidate you dislike least.
quotes.author: Robert Byrne

quotes.quote: Those who are too smart to engage in politics are punished by being governed by those who are dumber.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: Politics is the gentle art of getting votes from the poor and campaign funds from the rich, by promising to protect each from the other.
quotes.author: Oscar Ameringer

quotes.quote: An election is coming. Universal peace is declared and the foxes have a sincere interest in prolonging the lives of the poultry.
quotes.author: T.S. Eliot

quotes.quote: Politics are almost as exciting as war, and quite as dangerous. In war you can only be killed once, but in politics many times.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: The office of government is not to confer happiness but to give men the opportunity to work out happiness for themselves.
quotes.author: William Channing

quotes.quote: The impersonal hand of government can never replace the helping hand of a neighbor.
quotes.author: Hubert Humphrey

quotes.quote: Human freedom is a complex, difficult and private thing.
quotes.author: James Baldwin

quotes.quote: If we can liken life for a moment, to a furnace, the freedom is a fire which burns away illusion.
quotes.author: James Baldwin

quotes.quote: The oppressed and the oppressor alike are robbed of freedom.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: I am not truly free if I am taking away someone else's freedom, just as surely as I am not free when my freedom is taken from me.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: As Liberal Democrats and proponents of federalism, we must put our heads above the parapet and recapture and disseminate the true meaning of federalism. We have to win the vocabulary before we succeed in the vision.
quotes.author: Charles Kennedy

quotes.quote: The Democrats do fine in presidential elections; their problem is they can't get out the vote in the midterm elections.
quotes.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

quotes.quote: Democrats should be focused on which way we can help the most people in this country, and Republicans should be focused on how to do that in the most fiscally responsible manner possible.
quotes.author: Lewis Black

quotes.quote: The Democrats can engage in the most reprehensible; mean-spirited; vile; vicious verbal attacks known in politics; and they get praised for it.
quotes.author: Rush Limbaugh

quotes.quote: Democrats always assure us that deterrence will work, but when the time comes to deter, they're against it.
quotes.author: Ann Coulter

quotes.quote: The biggest strength we have as Democrats is encouraging people to speak up about what is in their best interest.
quotes.author: Valerie Jarrett

quotes.quote: Real Democrats stand strong for truth telling, and never compromise with corruption.
quotes.author: Leland Lewis

quotes.quote: The true democrat is he who with purely nonviolent means defends his liberty and, therefore, his country's and ultimately that of the whole of mankind.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: Democrats always standing up for what they later realize they should have believed in.
quotes.author: Jon Stewart

quotes.quote: The Democrats seem to be basically nicer people, but they have demonstrated time and again that they have the management skills of celery.
quotes.author: Dave Barry

quotes.quote: Democrats are trying on every front to increase the role of government.
quotes.author: Barney Frank

quotes.quote: The Democrats have this high level of expectation of what government can do.
quotes.author: Mark Shields

quotes.quote: The way the Democrats go about seeking equality is to lower people at the top.
quotes.author: Rush Limbaugh

quotes.quote: Democrats believe we must have comprehensive health care reform that includes giving the federal government authority to negotiate lower prices with drug companies.
quotes.author: Jim Clyburn

quotes.quote: The father is always a Republican toward his son, and his mother's always a Democrat.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.quote: The Democrats have no actual policy proposals of their own unless constant carping counts as a policy.
quotes.author: Ann Coulter

quotes.quote: Democrats never agree on anything, that's why they're Democrats. If they agreed with each other, they would be Republicans.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: Democrats believe people are basically good but must be saved from themselves by the government. Republicans believe people are basically bad but they'll be okay if they're left alone.
quotes.author: Andy Rooney

quotes.quote: The democrats think that as they are equal they ought to be equal in all things.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Democrats want to use the slowdown as an excuse to do what their special interests are always begging for: higher taxes, bigger government and less trade with other nations.
quotes.author: Mitt Romney
