quotes.quote: For every discouragement has been allowed to come to us in order that through it we may be cast in utter helplessness at the Saviour's feet.
quotes.author: Alan Redpath

quotes.quote: Discouragement is simply the despair of wounded self-love.
quotes.author: Francois Fenelon

quotes.quote: Discouragement seizes us only when we can no longer count on chance.
quotes.author: George Sand

quotes.quote: Discouragement is contagious and is easily transmitted to others.
quotes.author: Max Anders

quotes.quote: Discouragement often is a result of listening to people who have their own best interests planned for your life.
quotes.author: Doug Firebaugh

quotes.quote: Discouragement itself is a form of pride.
quotes.author: Therese of Lisieux

quotes.quote: Discouragement is not the absence of adequacy but the absence of courage.
quotes.author: Neal A. Maxwell

quotes.quote: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
quotes.author: Dale Carnegie

quotes.quote: The only way to discover the limits of the possible is to go beyond them into the impossible.
quotes.author: Arthur C. Clarke

quotes.quote: To discover the real you, look at what you spend time thinking about when no one is looking.
quotes.author: Timothy Keller

quotes.quote: We need to discover a common middle ground in which all of these things, from the city to the wilderness, can somehow be encompassed in the word â€œhome.â€
quotes.author: William Cronon

quotes.quote: When you discover that all happiness is inside you, the wanting and needing are over, and life gets very exciting.
quotes.author: Byron Katie

quotes.quote: One day, in your search for happiness, you discover a partner by your side, and you realize that your happiness has come to help you search.
quotes.author: Robert Breault

quotes.quote: As you grow older, you will discover that your mind is the only truly limiting factor in your life. With a well developed mind you can go anywhere and do whatever. But nothing comes automatically and the best things don't come easy.
quotes.author: Don Pendleton

quotes.quote: Coaching is helping people discover what they could not discover on their own, so they can become what they want to become.
quotes.author: Aubrey Malphurs

quotes.quote: Discover your deep inner-self and from that place spread love in every direction.
quotes.author: Amit Ray

quotes.quote: In order to discover the character of people we have only to observe what they love.
quotes.author: Saint Augustine

quotes.quote: We discover in ourselves what others hide from us and we recognize in others what we hide from ourselves.
quotes.author: Luc De Clapiers

quotes.quote: Sometimes, the only way to discover who we are, is by figuring out who we are not.
quotes.author: Nina Dobrev

quotes.quote: Discover the joy of giving and you will discover the reason for living.
quotes.author: Mark Victor Hansen

quotes.quote: We often discover what will do, by finding out what will not do; and probably he who never made a mistake never made a discovery.
quotes.author: Samuel Smiles

quotes.quote: One does not discover new lands without consenting to lose sight of the shore for a very long time.
quotes.author: Andre Gide

quotes.quote: Without frustration you will not discover that you might be able to do something on your own. We grow through conflict.
quotes.author: Bruce Lee

quotes.quote: Discover yourself, otherwise you have to depend on other people's opinions who don't know themselves.
quotes.author: Rajneesh

quotes.quote: Challenges make you discover things about yourself that you never really knew.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Try to discover The road to success And you'll seek but never find, But blaze your own path And the road to success Will trail right behind.
quotes.author: Robert Breault

quotes.quote: Those who claim to discover everything but produce no proofs of the same may be confuted as having actually pretended to discover the impossible.
quotes.author: Archimedes

quotes.quote: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.
quotes.author: Galileo Galilei

quotes.quote: When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves.
quotes.author: Willam Artuhr Ward

quotes.quote: Work hard to discover your gift and you will never envy or hate another human being who is manifesting theirs.
quotes.author: Louis Farrakhan

quotes.quote: We must discover the joy of each other, the joy of challenge, the joy of growth.
quotes.author: Mitsugi Saotome

quotes.quote: We need to discover the root causes of success rather than the root causes of failure.
quotes.author: David Cooperrider

quotes.quote: We learn to love our sweat, we discover our passion to move and connect it to effort, we discover both the animal in us and the power of our imagination.
quotes.author: Ohad Naharin

quotes.quote: Nobody can discover the world for somebody else. Only when we discover it for ourselves does it become common ground and a common bond and we cease to be alone.
quotes.author: Wendell Berry

quotes.quote: The way you discover your gifts is really by serving not by searching.
quotes.author: Loren Cunningham

quotes.quote: The things we discover for ourselves are the most important.
quotes.author: Pina Bausch

quotes.quote: Discovery consists of seeing what everybody has seen, and thinking what nobody has thought.
quotes.author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi

quotes.quote: Discovery, they believe, is inevitable. So they just try to do it first. That's the game in science.
quotes.author: Michael Crichton

quotes.quote: There is no better high than discovery.
quotes.author: E. O. Wilson

quotes.quote: No great discovery was ever made without a bold guess.
quotes.author: Isaac Newton

quotes.quote: Discovery should come as an adventure rather than as the result of a logical process of thought.
quotes.author: Theobald Smith

quotes.quote: Discovery is the ability to be puzzled by simple things.
quotes.author: Noam Chomsky

quotes.quote: Discovery hapens in the overlap of difference communities in the clashes of difference.
quotes.author: Scott Belsky

quotes.quote: The discovery of the power of our thoughts will prove to be the most important discovery of our time.
quotes.author: William James

quotes.quote: The more original a discovery, the more obvious it seems afterwards.
quotes.author: Arthur Koestler

quotes.quote: One doesn't discover new lands without consenting to lose sight of the shore for a very long time.
quotes.author: Andre Gide

quotes.quote: Every discovery contains an irrational element or a creative intuition.
quotes.author: Karl Popper

quotes.quote: A discovery is said to be an accident meeting a prepared mind.
quotes.author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi

quotes.quote: Our real discoveries come from chaos, from going to the place that looks wrong and stupid and foolish.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.quote: Discovery is seeing what everybody else has seen, and thinking what nobody else has thought.
quotes.author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi

quotes.quote: Discover what you need to do to make your life have meaning.
quotes.author: Sunday Adelaja

quotes.quote: Discovery is exciting, no matter how big or small or close or distant
quotes.author: Mike Brown

quotes.quote: Discovery consists of looking at the same thing as everyone else and thinking something different.
quotes.author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi

quotes.quote: One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.
quotes.author: A.A. Milne

quotes.quote: The process of scientific discovery is, in effect, a continual flight from wonder.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The discovery of a new dish does more for human happiness than the discovery of a new star.
quotes.author: Anthelme Brillat-Savarin

quotes.quote: Discovery is always rape of the natural world. Always.
quotes.author: Michael Crichton

quotes.quote: Discoveries are often made by not following instructions, by going off the main road, by trying the untried.
quotes.author: Frank Tyger

quotes.quote: They are ill discoverers that think there is no land, when they can see nothing but sea.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Discovery is the journey; insight is the destination.
quotes.author: Gary Hamel

quotes.quote: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
quotes.author: Andre Gide

quotes.quote: To discover the original plan of God is to manifest the work of creation.
quotes.author: Sunday Adelaja

quotes.quote: Discover what you could do with your life and empower yourself in that area. Add value to yourself in that your area of calling.
quotes.author: Sunday Adelaja

quotes.quote: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.
quotes.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quotes.quote: The voyage of discovery is not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.quote: Discovery requires courage and acceptance that we are not in control, and that the future is uncertain.
quotes.author: Bryant H. McGill

quotes.quote: The final discovery is the discovery of knowledge.
quotes.author: Kedar Joshi

quotes.quote: The greatest discovery of our generation is that human beings can alter their lives by altering their attitudes of mind. As you think, so shall you be.
quotes.author: William James

quotes.quote: Greater even than the greatest discovery is to keep open the way to future discovery.
quotes.author: John Jacob Abel

quotes.quote: A great discovery is a fact whose appearance in science gives rise to shining ideas, whose light dispels many obscurities and shows us new paths.
quotes.author: Claude Bernard

quotes.quote: Things don't turn up in this world until somebody turns them up.
quotes.author: James A. Garfield

quotes.quote: I do not much wish well to discoveries, for I am always afraid they will end in conquest and robbery.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: No man ever made a great discovery without the exercise of the imagination.
quotes.author: George Henry Lewes

quotes.quote: Nearly every great discovery in science has come as the result of providing a new question rather than a new answer.
quotes.author: Paul A. Meglitsch

quotes.quote: Printing, gunpowder, and the mariner's needle (compass), these three have changed the whole face and state of things throughout the world.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Through the unknown, we'll find the new.
quotes.author: Charles Baudelaire

quotes.quote: The more original the discovery, the more obvious it seems afterward.
quotes.author: Arthur Koestler

quotes.quote: There are two possible outcomes: if the result confirms the hypothesis, then you've made the discovery. If the result is contrary to the hypothesis, then you've made a discovery.
quotes.author: Enrico Fermi

quotes.quote: You must be satisfied with making discoveries. Take care never to offer explanations.
quotes.author: Georges Braque

quotes.quote: The most important of my discoveries have been suggested to me by my failures.
quotes.author: Humphrey Davy

quotes.quote: The word 'discovery' in itself is regrettable. For discovery is equivalent to becoming aware of a thing which is already formed; this links up with proof, which no longer bears the character of 'discovery' but, in the final analysis, of the means that lead to discovery...Discovery is really not a creative act.
quotes.author: Einstein

quotes.quote: We often discover what will do, by finding out what will not do; and probably he who never made a mistake never made a discovery.
quotes.author: Samuel Smiles

quotes.quote: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance— it is the illusion of knowledge.
quotes.author: Daniel Boorstin

quotes.quote: A man of genius makes no mistakes; his errors are volitional and are portals of discovery.
quotes.author: James Joyce

quotes.quote: The delights of self-discovery are always available.
quotes.author: Gail Sheehy

quotes.quote: A new principle in an exhaustible source of new views.
quotes.author: Vauvenargues

quotes.quote: If I have ever made any valuable discoveries, it has been owing more to patient attention, than to any other talent.
quotes.author: Sir Isaac Newton

quotes.quote: It is a profound mistake to think that everything has been discovered; as well as think the horizon the boundary of the world.
quotes.author: Lemierre

quotes.quote: Through every rift of discovery, some seeming anomaly drops out of the darkness, and falls, as a golden link, into the great chain of order.
quotes.author: F.H.Chapin

quotes.quote: It's true that by blundering about, we stumbled on gold, but the fact remains that we were looking for gold.
quotes.author: Francis Crick

quotes.quote: Figuring out that new something, / the new direction, or the difference in what / you're doing, can be a brain-wracking experience.
quotes.author: Kent Krauss

quotes.quote: There'll always be serendipity involved in the discovery.
quotes.author: Jeff Bezos

quotes.quote: If I have learned anything in this long life of mine, it is this: in love, we find out who we want to be; in war, we find out who we are.
quotes.author: Kristin Hannah

quotes.quote: Some beautiful paths can't be discovered without getting lost.
quotes.author: Erol Ozan

quotes.quote: Never underestimate the power of thought; it is the greatest path to discovery.
quotes.author: Idowu Koyenikan

quotes.quote: What I learned on my own I still remember.
quotes.author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

quotes.quote: The seeker embarks on a journey to find what he wants and discovers, along the way, what he needs.
quotes.author: Wally Lamb

quotes.quote: We don't receive wisdom we must discover it for ourselves.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.quote: All food is fit to eat but not all words are fit to speak.
quotes.author: Haitian (on discretion)

quotes.quote: Discretion is the better part of valor.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Don't spill the beans.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: For news of the heart, ask the face.
quotes.author: Guinean (on life and living)

quotes.quote: Forethought is easy, repentance is hard.
quotes.author: Chinese (on discretion)

quotes.quote: Give thy thoughts no tongue.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Having two ears and one tongue, we should listen twice as much as we speak.
quotes.author: Turkish (on discretion)

quotes.quote: Least said, soonest mended
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Little pitchers have big ears.
quotes.author: John Heywood

quotes.quote: Nothing is as burdensome as a secret.
quotes.author: French Proverb

quotes.quote: Proclaim not all thou knowest, all thou owest, all thou hast, nor all thou can'st.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Silence is sometimes the answer.
quotes.author: Estonian (on discretion)

quotes.quote: Some things are better left unsaid.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Stones decay, words last.
quotes.author: Samoan (on discretion)

quotes.quote: The tongue has no bones, yet it breaks bones.
quotes.author: Greek (on discretion)

quotes.quote: Words should be weighed not counted.
quotes.author: Yiddish (on discretion)

quotes.quote: Discretion is the perfection of reason, and a guide to us in all the duties of life.
quotes.author: Walter Scott

quotes.quote: Discretion is nothing other than the sense of justice with respect to the sphere of the intimate contents of life.
quotes.author: Georg Simmel

quotes.quote: Discretion is the polite word for hypocrisy.
quotes.author: Christine Keeler

quotes.quote: Judgment is not upon all occasions required, but discretion always is.
quotes.author: Philip Stanhope

quotes.quote: A sound discretion is not so much indicated by never making a mistake as by never repeating it.
quotes.author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quotes.quote: Discretion is the better part of not getting exsanguinated.
quotes.author: Jim Butcher

quotes.quote: Why must you speak your thoughts? Silence, if fair words stick in your throat, would serve all our ends better.
quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quotes.quote: Discretion is a girl's best friend. Learn when to use it, and when to let it slip.
quotes.author: Jennifer Megan Varnadore

quotes.quote: Discretion is being able to raise your eyebrow instead of your voice.
quotes.author: Author Unknown

quotes.quote: Discretion is the salt, and fancy the sugar of life; the one preserves, the other sweetens it.
quotes.author: John Christian Bovee

quotes.quote: The age of discretion is the age of impotence.
quotes.author: Author Unknown

quotes.quote: Without discretion, people may be overlaid with unreasonable affection, and choked with too much nourishment.
quotes.author: Jeremy Collier

quotes.quote: Be discreet in all things, and so render it unnecessary to be mysterious
quotes.author: Author Unknown

quotes.quote: Discretion of speech is more than eloquence, and to speak agreeably to him with whom we deal is more than to speak in good words, or in good order.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Be wiser than other people, if you can; but do not tell them so.
quotes.author: Lord Chesterfield

quotes.quote: Depart from discretion when it interferes with duty.
quotes.author: Hannah More

quotes.quote: A closed mouth catches no flies.
quotes.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quotes.quote: An ounce of discretion is worth a pound of wit.
quotes.author: American Proverb

quotes.quote: Let your own discretion be your tutor: suit the action to the word, the word to the action.
quotes.author: Hamlet

quotes.quote: Never say 'oops' in the operating room.
quotes.author: Dr. Leo Troy

quotes.quote: A sound discretion is not so much indicated by never making a mistake as by never repeating it.
quotes.author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quotes.quote: Every man has a certain sphere of discretion which he has a right to expect shall not be infringed by his neighbours. This right flows from the very nature of man.
quotes.author: William Godwin

quotes.quote: Nothing is more dangerous than a friend without discretion; even a prudent enemy is preferable.
quotes.author: Jean de la Fontaine

quotes.quote: The prudent man is always sincere, and feels horror at the very thought of exposing himself to the disgrace which attends upon the detection of falsehood. But though always sincere, he is not always frank and open; and though he never tells any thing but the truth, he does not always think himself bound, when not properly called upon, to tell the whole truth. As he is cautious in his actions, so he is reserved in his speech; and never rashly or unnecessarily obtrudes his opinion concerning either things or persons.
quotes.author: Adam Smith

quotes.quote: I consider it a mark of great prudence in a man to abstain from threats or any contemptuous expressions, for neither of these weaken the enemy, but threats make him more cautious, and the other excites his hatred, and a desire to revenge himself.
quotes.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quotes.quote: Prudence is the virtue by which we discern what is proper to do under various circumstances in time and place.
quotes.author: John Milton

quotes.quote: Men are born with two eyes, but with one tongue, in order that they should see twice as much as they say.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.quote: Have more than you show. Speak less than you know.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Live without pretending. Love without depending. Listen without defending. Speak without offending.
quotes.author: Drake

quotes.quote: Of all the virtues, discretion began to seem the most rewarding: it kept people guessing and sometimes, by default, admiring.
quotes.author: Julia Glass

quotes.quote: Don't underestimate me. I know more than I say, think more rhan I speak and notice more than you realize.
quotes.author: Author Unknown

quotes.quote: No matter what they tell you, you don't have to stay within the lines.
quotes.author: Author Unknown

quotes.quote: Absolute discretion is a ruthless master. It is more destructive of freedom than any of man's other inventions.
quotes.author: William O. Douglas

quotes.quote: Be discreet in all things, and so render it unnecessary to be mysterious about any.
quotes.author: Wellington

quotes.quote: open your mouth and purse cautiously, and your stock of wealth and reputation shall, at least in repute, be great.
quotes.author: Zimmerman

quotes.quote: The better part of valor is discretion, in the which better part I have saved my life.
quotes.author: Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Discretion is the perfection of reason and a guide to us in all the duties of life. It is only found in men of sound sense and good understanding.
quotes.author: Bruyere

quotes.quote: If thou art a master, be sometimes blind, if a servant, sometimes deaf.
quotes.author: Fuller

quotes.quote: To know the evil of others and not speak it is sometimes discretion; to speak evil of others and not know it, is always dishonesty.
quotes.author: A. Warwick

quotes.quote: Judgment is not upon all occasions required, but discretion always is.
quotes.author: Lord Chesterfield

quotes.quote: Not only to say the right thing in the right place but, far more difficult still, to leave unsaid the wrong thing at the tempting moment.
quotes.author: George A. Sala

quotes.quote: Forbear to mention what thou canst not praise.
quotes.author: Matthew Prior

quotes.quote: You never know till you try to reach them how accessible men are, but you must approach each man by the right door.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.quote: If indeed you must be candid, be candid beautifully.
quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

quotes.quote: Only trust thyself, and another shall not betray thee.
quotes.author: William Penn

quotes.quote: When information is withheld, ignorance becomes a reasonable excuse. They see not, therefore they feel not.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.quote: Great ability without discretion comes almost invariably to a tragic end.
quotes.author: Gambetta

quotes.quote: When wisdom entereth into thine heart and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul, discretion shall preserve thee, and understanding shall keep thee.
quotes.author: Proverbs 2:10-11

quotes.quote: Why do you judge or look down on your brother?; for we all shall stand before the judgment seat of God.
quotes.author: Roman 14:10

quotes.quote: It is not well to see everything, nor to hear everything.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
quotes.author: William James

quotes.quote: If one person tells thou hast to assess' ears, take no notice; should two tell thee so, procure a saddle for thyself.
quotes.author: Hebrew Proverb

quotes.quote: A wise man wavers, a fool is fixed.
quotes.author: Scottish Proverb

quotes.quote: One is received according to one's coat; one is dismissed according to one's brain.
quotes.author: Russian Proverb

quotes.quote: Thy friend has a friend, and thy friend's friend has a friend: be discreet.
quotes.author: Hebrew Proverb

quotes.quote: Discretion is the perfection of reason and a guide to us in all the duties of life. It is only found in men of sound sense and understanding.
quotes.author: Jean De La Bruyere

quotes.quote: Discretion is leaving a few things unsaid.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: Ah, turn your pretty eyes away! / You would not have me love again? / Love's pleasure does not live a day, / Immortal is Love's pain, / And I am tired of the pain.
quotes.author: Edith Nesbitt

quotes.quote: One can pass on responsibility, but not the discretion that goes with it.
quotes.author: Benvenuto Cellini

quotes.quote: Discretion is a synonym for intelligence.
quotes.author: Eloisa James

quotes.quote: Philosophy is nothing but discretion.
quotes.author: John Selden

quotes.quote: If you tell someone a secret and ask them to keep it secret, you are asking them to display a discretion you are unable to display yourself.
quotes.author: Jill Paton Walsh

quotes.quote: While discretion points out the impropriety of my conduct, inclination urges me on to ruin.
quotes.author: Susanna Rowson

quotes.quote: There should be no discrimination against languages people speak, skin color, or religion.
quotes.author: Malala Yousafzai

quotes.quote: Discrimination has a lot of layers that make it tough for minorities to get a leg up.
quotes.author: Bill Gates

quotes.quote: Discrimination is a disease.
quotes.author: Roger Staubach

quotes.quote: No change can come if those who are impacted the most by discrimination are not willing to stand up for themselves.
quotes.author: Zainab Salbi

quotes.quote: I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin but by the content of their character.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.quote: If you believe that discrimination exists, it will.
quotes.author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

quotes.quote: How I wish we lived in a time when laws were not necessary to safeguard us from discrimination.
quotes.author: Barbra Streisand

quotes.quote: It is not discrimination to treat different things differently.
quotes.author: Maggie Gallagher

quotes.quote: Humans are naturally elusioned in discrimination; it starts when we look for the first time in mirror.
quotes.author: M.F. Moonzajer

quotes.quote: Discrimination is discrimination, even when people claim it's "tradition.
quotes.author: DaShanne Stokes

quotes.quote: Reducing a group to a slur or stereotype reduces us all.
quotes.author: DaShanne Stokes

quotes.quote: At the end of the game, the king and the pawn go back in the same box.
quotes.author: Italian Proverb

quotes.quote: Men's skins have many colors, but human blood is always red.
quotes.author: Proverb

quotes.quote: White, black and yellow men - they all cry salt tears.
quotes.author: Claude Aveline

quotes.quote: When you introduce discrimination of any kind, it's anti-innovative.
quotes.author: David Isenberg

quotes.quote: We should be doing our utmost to ensure that all are protected against discrimination.
quotes.author: Henry A. Waxman

quotes.quote: I believe in human beings, and that all human beings should be respected as such, regardless of their color.
quotes.author: Malcolm X

quotes.quote: Love, all alike, no season knows, nor clime, nor hours, days, months, which are the rags of time.
quotes.author: John Donne

quotes.quote: Hating people because of their color is wrong. And it doesn't matter which color does the hating. It's just plain wrong.
quotes.author: Muhammad Ali

quotes.quote: And each of us can practice rights ourselves, treating each other without discrimination, respecting each other's dignity and rights.
quotes.author: Carol Bellamy

quotes.quote: Our true nationality is mankind.
quotes.author: H.G. Wells

quotes.quote: Achievement has no color.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: No one is born hating another person because of the color of his skin, or his background, or his religion. People must learn to hate, and if they can learn to hate, they can be taught to love, for love comes more naturally to the human heart than its opposite.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: The color of the skin is in no way connected with strength of the mind or intellectual powers.
quotes.author: Benjamin Banneker

quotes.quote: When we're unemployed, we're called lazy; when the whites are unemployed it's called a depression.
quotes.author: Jesse Jackson

quotes.quote: Be nice to whites, they need you to rediscover their humanity.
quotes.author: Desmond Tutu

quotes.quote: The way to stop Discrimination on the basis of race is to stop discriminating on the basis of race.
quotes.author: John Roberts

quotes.quote: It is often easier to become outraged by injustice half a world away than by oppression and Discrimination half a block from home.
quotes.author: Carl T. Rowan

quotes.quote: The law prohibits Discrimination on the basis of race, gender, marital status, political beliefs, disability, or age, and the government effectively enforced these prohibitions.
quotes.author: U.S. State Department Report, 2010

quotes.quote: Discrimination due to age is one of the great tragedies of modern life. The desire to work and be useful is what makes life worth living, and to be told your efforts are not needed because you are the wrong age is a crime.
quotes.author: Johnny Ball

quotes.quote: I believe discrimination still exists in society and we must fight it in every form.
quotes.author: Andrew Cuomo

quotes.quote: What is required of a working hypothesis is a fine capacity for discrimination.
quotes.author: Jean-Francois Lyotard

quotes.quote: I have an intensive hatred for discrimination based on colour.
quotes.author: John Diefenbaker

quotes.quote: Discrimination still exists. Some people feel that their own beliefs are being threatened. Some are unhappy about unfamiliar cultures. They all need to be reassured that there is so much to be gained by reaching out to others; that diversity is indeed a strength and not a threat.
quotes.author: Elizabeth II

quotes.quote: In the long run, there is not much discrimination against superior talent.
quotes.author: Carter G. Woodson

quotes.quote: If we were to wake up some morning and find that everyone was the same race, creed and color, we would find some other causes for prejudice by noon.
quotes.author: George Aiken

quotes.quote: The failure of women to have reached positions of leadership has been due in large part to social and professional discrimination.
quotes.author: Rosalyn Sussman Yalow

quotes.quote: Our global community has come a long way in helping to eliminate discrimination, but we still have far to go.
quotes.author: Robert Alan Silverstein

quotes.quote: Sexual, racial, gender violence and other forms of discrimination and violence in a culture cannot be eliminated without changing culture.
quotes.author: Charlotte Bunch

quotes.quote: ...we need to realize that we have a role to play in overcoming our own discrimination which is sometimes very subtly held
quotes.author: Bishop Samuel Ruiz Garcia

quotes.quote: All human beings bear God's image and must be respected for what each person is. Therefore, no external description of one's being, whether based on race, ethnicity, gender or sexual orientation, can properly be used as the basis for either rejection or discrimination.
quotes.author: Bishop John Shelby Spong

quotes.quote: Of all treasons against humanity, there is no one worse than his who employs great intellectual force to keep down the intellect of his less favored brothers.
quotes.author: William Ellery Channing

quotes.quote: DISCRIMINATE, v.i. To note the particulars in which one person or thing is, if possible, more objectionable than another.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: The sage embraces things. Ordinary men discriminate amongst them and parade their discriminations before others. So I say; those who discriminate, fail to see.
quotes.author: Zhuangzi

quotes.quote: When calamity approaches, discrimination departs.
quotes.author: Sri Sathya Sai Baba

quotes.quote: We cannot continue to sweep the problems of segregation and discrimination under the rug.
quotes.author: Thomas Sugrue

quotes.quote: The ills of discrimination are still with us. We have to continue the tenacity and vigilance of the 1960s. Racial understanding is not something we find; it's something we create.
quotes.author: Thomas Cole

quotes.quote: Like a pet fish unaware of the fishbowl it lives in, each of us inherently discriminates against young people without knowing it.
quotes.author: Adam Fletcher

quotes.quote: Discrimination means keeping the negative and unhappy thoughts away and allowing the pretty thoughts to come inside you.
quotes.author: Frederick Lenz

quotes.quote: Unfortunately, discrimination is alive and well. After 41 years of addressing it, we get over 80,000 complaints annually and over a million phone calls.
quotes.author: Cari M. Dominguez

quotes.quote: We call upon all communities to be tolerant—to reject prejudice based on cast, creed, sect, religion or gender. To ensure freedom and equality for women so that they can flourish. We cannot all succeed when half of us are held back.
quotes.author: Malala Yousafzai

quotes.quote: To those who are lesbian, gay, bisexual or transgender, let me say: You are not alone. Your struggle for an end to violence and discrimination is a shared struggle. Any attack on you is an attack on the universal values the United Nations and I have sworn to defend and uphold. Today, I stand with you, and I call upon all countries and people to stand with you, too.
quotes.author: Ban Ki-moon

quotes.quote: The moment a little boy is concerned with which is a jay and which is a sparrow, he can no longer see the birds or hear them sing.
quotes.author: Eric Berne

quotes.quote: The only difference between man and man all the world over is one of degree, and not of kind, even as there is between trees of the same species. Where in is the cause for anger, envy or discrimination?
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: Equality is not the empirical claim that all groups of humans are interchangeable; it is the moral principle that individuals should not be judged or constrained by the average properties of their group.
quotes.author: Steven Pinker

quotes.quote: The one thing that the racist can never manage is anything like discrimination: he is indiscriminate by definition.
quotes.author: Christopher Hitchens

quotes.quote: If we are to fight discrimination and injustice against women we must start from the home for if a woman cannot be safe in her own house then she cannot be expected to feel safe anywhere.
quotes.author: Aysha Taryam

quotes.quote: The way we imagine discrimination or disempowerment often is more complicated for people who are subjected to multiple forms of exclusion. The good news is that intersectionality provides us a way to see it.
quotes.author: Kimberle Williams Crenshaw

quotes.quote: Discrimination must always be drawn out, like venom from the wound.
quotes.author: Sharon Needles

quotes.quote: There are still traces of discrimination against race and gender, but it's a lot different than when I started out. It just comes quietly, slowly, sometimes so quietly that you don't realize it until you start looking back.
quotes.author: Eddie Bernice Johnson

quotes.quote: White people, White men, need to be more outraged with the injustices of racism and discrimination than we are when someone is telling us that they don't like something that we are doing.
quotes.author: Matt McGorry

quotes.quote: Sometimes, I feel discriminated against, but it does not make me angry. It merely astonishes me. How can any deny themselves the pleasure of my company? It's beyond me.
quotes.author: Zora Neale Hurston

quotes.quote: Can we see in each other a common humanity, a shared dignity, and recognize how our different experiences have shaped us?
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.quote: Differences are not intended to separate, to alienate. We are different precisely in order to realize our need of one another.
quotes.author: Archbishop Desmond Tutu

quotes.quote: What we need now more than ever is a human rights movement that challenges systemic racism in every single context.
quotes.author: Opal Tometi

quotes.quote: Weakness is what brings ignorance, cheapness, racism, homophobia, cruelty, brutality, all these things that will keep a society chained to the ground, one foot nailed to the floor.
quotes.author: Henry Rollins

quotes.quote: We'll have our rights; See if we don't; And you can't stop us from them; See if you can.
quotes.author: Sojourner Truth

quotes.quote: Discrimination is a hellhound that gnaws at Negroes in every waking moment of their lives to remind them that the lie of their inferiority is accepted as truth in the society dominating them.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.quote: There is no place for discrimination in the United States of America. And if there's anybody in the communities around this country that are being hurt by it, we have got to come together and do everything we can to see that it doesn't go on.
quotes.author: George H. W. Bush

quotes.quote: Racial discrimination and racism are an insult to God.
quotes.author: George Sweeting

quotes.quote: Why is it that men can be bastards and women must wear pearls and smile?
quotes.author: Lynn Hecht Schafran

quotes.quote: White people now tan to get darker; and black people wear their hair like white people. We are all confused. Deep down we admire each other, but we don't accept it. The silly thing is that color of one's skin is simply evolution's answer for dealing with different rates of exposure to the sun. How ignorant is it then to judge a person on that?
quotes.author: Manasa Rao Saarloos

quotes.quote: I always looked upon the acts of racist exclusion, or insult, as pitiable, for the other person. I never absorbed that. I always thought that there was something deficient about such people.
quotes.author: Toni Morrison

quotes.quote: As I often say, we have come a long way from the days of slavery, but in 2014, discrimination and inequality still saturate our society in modern ways. Though racism may be less blatant now in many cases, its existence is undeniable.
quotes.author: Al Sharpton

quotes.quote: Last time I was down South I walked into this restaurant, and this white waitress came up to me and said: 'We don't serve colored people here.' I said: 'that's all right, I don't eat colored people. Bring me a whole fried chicken.
quotes.author: Dick Gregory

quotes.quote: Latinos come from different countries, and they tend to segregate with only their country instead of embracing all other countries, because in reality, all the Latinos are going through the same experiences of discrimination and racism.
quotes.author: Andrea Navedo

quotes.quote: It is not our differences that divide us. It is our inability to recognize, accept, and celebrate those differences.
quotes.author: Audre Lorde

quotes.quote: Yeah, I love being famous. It's almost like being white, y'know?
quotes.author: Chris Rock

quotes.quote: Until the killing of black men, black mothers' sons, becomes as important as the killing of white men, white mothers' sons, we who believe in freedom cannot rest.
quotes.author: Ella J. Baker

quotes.quote: I was thinking about all the honors that are showered on me in the theater, how everyone wishes to shake my hand or get an autograph, a real hero you'd naturally think. However, when I reach a hotel, I am refused permission to ride on the passenger elevator, I cannot enter the dining room for my meals, and am Jim Crowed generally... I know this to be an unbelievable custom.
quotes.author: Bert Williams

quotes.quote: Discrimination and intolerance will eat you up and destroy whatever creativity was in you if you let it.
quotes.author: Gordon Parks

quotes.quote: This is the essence of discrimination: formulating opinions about others not based on their individual merits, but rather on their membership in a group with assumed characteristics.
quotes.author: Joe Miller

quotes.quote: We should not be held back from pursuing our full talents, from contributing what we could contribute to the society, because we fit into a certain mold- because we belong to a group that historically has been the object of discrimination.
quotes.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

quotes.quote: One life lost is one life too many. That is why human rights experts around the world have recognized that gender-based violence is a form of discrimination.
quotes.author: Naomi Fontanes

quotes.quote: The conviction that all men are equal by reason of their natural dignity has been generally accepted. Hence racial discrimination can no longer be justified.
quotes.author: Pope John XXIII

quotes.quote: Pride and vanity, the opposites of humility, can destroy our spiritual health as surely as a debilitating disease can destroy our physical health.
quotes.author: Joseph B. Wirthlin

quotes.quote: Diseased nature oftentimes breaks forth In strange eruptions.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Disease is the tax which the soul pays for the body, as the tenant pays house rent for the use of the house.
quotes.author: Ramakrishna

quotes.quote: If we're going to fight a disease, let's fight one of the most terrible diseases of all, indifference.
quotes.author: Robin Williams

quotes.quote: The worst disease in the world is hate. And the cure for hate is love.
quotes.author: India Arie

quotes.quote: Diseases crucify the soul of man, attenuate our bodies, dry them, wither them, rivel them up like old apples, make them as so many Anatomies.
quotes.author: Robert A. Burton

quotes.quote: Arrogance, pedantry, and dogmatism...the occupational diseases of those who spend their lives directing the intellects of the young.
quotes.author: Henry Siedel Canby

quotes.quote: All interest in disease and death is only another expression of interest in life.
quotes.author: Thomas Mann

quotes.quote: Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.
quotes.author: Wayne Gretzky

quotes.quote: There is no austerity equal to a balanced mind, and there is no happiness equal to contentment; there is no disease like covetousness, and no virtue like mercy.
quotes.author: Chanakya

quotes.quote: Old age is not a disease - it is strength and survivorship, triumph over all kinds of vicissitudes and disappointments, trials and illnesses.
quotes.author: Maggie Kuhn

quotes.quote: Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood.
quotes.author: Jane Yolen

quotes.quote: Stand up to ignorance, because if you don't, the ignorant will run free to spread ignorance like a disease.
quotes.author: Suzy Kassem

quotes.quote: It is much more important to know what sort of a patient has a disease than what sort of a disease a patient has.
quotes.author: William Osler

quotes.quote: Idleness of the mind is much worse than that of the body: wit, without employment, is a disease - the rust of the soul, a plague, a hell itself.
quotes.author: Samuel Smiles

quotes.quote: Youth is a disease from which we all recover.
quotes.author: Dorothy Fuldheim

quotes.quote: Bigotry is the disease of ignorance, of morbid minds; enthusiasm of the free and buoyant. education and free discussion are the antidotes of both.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Aggression unopposed becomes a contagious disease.
quotes.author: Jimmy Carter

quotes.quote: Diseases of the soul are more dangerous and more numerous than those of the body.
quotes.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.quote: Mathematics is like childhood diseases. The younger you get it, the better.
quotes.author: Arnold Sommerfield

quotes.quote: We all labor against our own cure, for death is the cure of all diseases.
quotes.author: Thomas Browne Sr.

quotes.quote: Great writers arrive among us like new diseases - threatening, powerful, impatient for patients to pick up their virus, irresistible.
quotes.author: Craig Raine

quotes.quote: One of the greatest diseases is to be nobody to anybody.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.quote: When one gets in bed with government, one must expect the diseases it spreads.
quotes.author: Ron Paul

quotes.quote: Disease may be defined as 'A change produced in living things in consequence of which they are no longer in harmony with their environment.
quotes.author: William Thomas Councilman

quotes.quote: Everything on the Earth has a purpose, every disease an herb to cure it, and every person a mission. This is the Indian theory of existence.
quotes.author: Morning Dove Salish

quotes.quote: Gossip is a disease spread from mouth to mouth.
quotes.author: Frank Sonnenberg

quotes.quote: Everything in food works together to create health or disease.
quotes.author: T Colin Campbell

quotes.quote: For that which is a disgrace to human nature, throws something of a shade over all the human character, and each individual feels his share of the wound that is given to the whole.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.quote: The thought of disgrace never touched her. She had no world whose verdict she might fear.
quotes.author: Mrs. Horace Field

quotes.quote: There are two ways of doing battle against Disgrace. You may live it down; or you may run away from it and hide. The first method is heart-breaking, but sure. The second cannot be relied upon because of the uncomfortable way Disgrace has of turning up at your heels.
quotes.author: Edna Ferber

quotes.quote: We can learn personal humility from episodes that generate shame and guilt. After retiring from worldly affairs and drawing useful lessons from personal disgrace, we must resume living an expedient life devoted to appreciating truth, beauty, and love.
quotes.author: Kilroy J. Oldster

quotes.quote: It is better to wait until you get the right thing, at the right time and in the right place; than to race for the wrong thing, at the wrong time and in the wrong place, for it yields nothing but disgrace.
quotes.author: Gift Gugu Mona

quotes.quote: There is no disgrace in being knocked down, there is only shame in not getting back up; never quit!
quotes.author: Ken Poirot

quotes.quote: Vain mistaken mortals, who, valuing themselves on names and titles, suppose that the virtues of the mind must be attached to an empty sound, when every day's experience proves that birth is disgraced, titles rendered contemptible, and riches a curse, by the vices, meanness, and dissipation of its possessors!
quotes.author: Eliza Parsons

quotes.quote: Labor disgraces no man; unfortunately, you occasionally find men who disgrace labor.
quotes.author: Ulysses S. Grant

quotes.quote: It isn't a disgrace not to reach the stars, but it is a disgrace to have no stars to reach for.
quotes.author: Benjamin E. Mays

quotes.quote: To have once been a criminal is no disgrace. To remain a criminal is the disgrace.
quotes.author: Malcolm X

quotes.quote: It is no small misfortune and disgrace that, through our own fault, we neither understand our nature nor our origin.
quotes.author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quotes.quote: The nation which can prefer disgrace to danger is prepared for a master and deserves one.
quotes.author: Alexander Hamilton

quotes.quote: And but two ways are offered to our will, Toil with rare triumph, ease with safe disgrace, The problem still for us and all of human race.
quotes.author: James Russell Lowell

quotes.quote: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently. There is no disgrace in honest failure; there is disgrace in fearing to fail.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: The future's mine and it's no disgrace, cos in the end the past means nothing.I feel a little down today, and I ain't got much to say.And if I stumble, catch me when I fall.
quotes.author: Noel Gallagher

quotes.quote: What a disgrace it is for a man to grow old without ever seeing the beauty and strength of which his body is capable.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: He is senseless who would match himself against a stronger man; for he is deprived of victory and adds suffering to disgrace.
quotes.author: Hesiod

quotes.quote: The coming of honor or disgrace must be a reflection of one's inner power.
quotes.author: Xunzi

quotes.quote: It is better to die than to preserve this life by incurring disgrace. The loss of life causes but a moment's grief, but disgrace brings grief every day of one's life.
quotes.author: Chanakya

quotes.quote: Whatever disgrace we may have deserved, it is almost always in our power to re-establish our character.
quotes.author: Plautus

quotes.quote: The man that gloats over another man's disgrace and thinks himself raised in dignity by it, is unworthy of future bliss.
quotes.author: Genesis Rabbah

quotes.quote: He who has achieved this state Is unconcerned with friends and enemies, With good and harm, with honor and disgrace. This therefore is the highest state of man.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.quote: To bear the country's disgrace is to rule the shrines of soil and grain. To bear the country's misfortunes is to be the king of the world.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.quote: Whatever ignominy or disgrace we have incurred, it is almost always in our power to reestablish our reputation.
quotes.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: The general who advances without coveting fame and retreats without fearing disgrace, whose only thought is to proctect his country country and do good service for his sovereign, is the jewel of the kingdom.
quotes.author: Sun Tzu

quotes.quote: A man whose life has been dishonourable is not entitled to escape disgrace in death.
quotes.author: Lucius Accius

quotes.quote: When we have lost everything, including hope, life becomes a disgrace, and death a duty.
quotes.author: W. C. Fields

quotes.quote: No matter what cause one defends, it will suffer permanent disgrace if one resorts to blind attacks on crowds of innocent people.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: The noble art of losing face may one day save the human race and turn into eternal merit what weaker minds would call disgrace.
quotes.author: Piet Pieterszoon Hein

quotes.quote: When a child outgrows whipping, he becomes a person one looks at and roll one's eyes in disgust.
quotes.author: Yoruba Proverb

quotes.quote: Women are reputed never to be disgusted. The sad fact is that they often are, but not with men; following the lead of men, they are most often disgusted with themselves.
quotes.author: George Seides

quotes.quote: Love turns with a little indulgence, to indifference or disgust, hatred alone is immortal.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.quote: When slavery is discussed and somebody rhapsodizes upon the goodness and kindness of masters and mistresses toward their slaves in extenuation of the cruel system, it is hard for me to conceal my disgust.
quotes.author: William J. Anderson

quotes.quote: And, where they hope that quiet to enjoy / Which virtue pictures, bitterness of soul,/ Pinning regrets and vain repentances,/ Disease, disgust, and lassitude pervade / Their valueless and miserable lives.
quotes.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quotes.quote: That which we at present call laziness is, rather, the disgust which men feel over breaking their backs for beggars' salaries and being, moreover, looked down upon and depreciated by the class which exploits them — while those who do nothing useful live like princes and are deffered to and respected by all.
quotes.author: Ricardo Flores Magon

quotes.quote: All noble hearts, all intellectual heads, have long ago turned away from the whole apparatus of government with genuine disgust, and the poll they hate like the plague.
quotes.author: Johan Most

quotes.quote: Normally, public displays of nudity and sex cause environment; they rouse feelings of disgust and shame. these feelings are natural barriers to perversion.
quotes.author: Melvin Anchell

quotes.quote: The most disgusting human trait is bias because it ends of leading to propaganda, hate and violence.
quotes.author: Lori Goodwin

quotes.quote: Man is a disgusting thing. If you beat him he starts to scream, but if it is the other one who is beaten, then he constructs a theory.
quotes.author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quotes.quote: There is no one on earth more disgusting and repulsive than he who gives alms. Even as there is no one so miserable as he who accepts them.
quotes.author: Maxim Gorky

quotes.quote: All is disgust when one leaves his own nature and does things that misfit it.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.quote: Love is disgusting when you no longer possess yourself.
quotes.author: Pola Negri

quotes.quote: The disgust with dirt can be so great that it keeps us from cleaning ourselves--from "justifying" ourselves.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: Even if you're disgusting, and everyone is creeped out by you and thinks you're gross, you know, keep doing what you love!
quotes.author: Maria Bamford

quotes.quote: I didn't leave the city in disgust— I left it with the respect plan an unadulterated fear gives.
quotes.author: Johnsteinbeck

quotes.quote: I am an absolute pacifist...It is an instinctive feeling. It is a feeling that possesses me, because the murder of men is disgusting.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: I don't dislike babies, though I think very young ones are rather discussing
quotes.author: Victoria

quotes.quote: Achievement— the death of endeavor and the birth of disgust.
quotes.author: John Bartlett

quotes.quote: No fear can stand up to hunger, no patience can wear it out, disgust simply does not exist where hunger is; and as to superstition, beliefs, and what you may call principles, they are less than chaff in a breeze.
quotes.author: John Bartlett

quotes.quote: The Goops they lick their fingers, / And the Goops they lick their knives; / They spill their broth on the tablecloth—/ Oh, they lead disgusting lives! / The Goops they talk while eating, / And loud and fast they chew; / And that is why I'm glad that I / am not a Goop— are you?
quotes.author: John Bartlett

quotes.quote: The good missionary , disgusted with this idle tale, said, 'What I delivered to you were sacred truths; but what you tell me is mere fable, fiction, and falsehood.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Friendships that are disproportioned ever terminate in disgust. He cast off his friends, as a huntsman his pack; For he knew, when he pleased, he could whistle them back.
quotes.author: Oliver Goldsmith

quotes.quote: You speak of God frequently. It is a word I no longer use, ' an ex-nun writes me. Not everyone has the good fortune to be disgusted by it.
quotes.author: E.M. Cioran

quotes.quote: A smear of soup on a man's beard looks disgusting, though there is of course nothing disgusting in the soup itself.
quotes.author: Darwin

quotes.quote: Not all disgust need produce symptoms of nausea, nor all nausea mark the presence of disgust.
quotes.author: William Ian Miler

quotes.quote: What is considered disgusting at one dining table is regarded as delicious in another.
quotes.author: Barry Smith

quotes.quote: Dishonesty of any kind will create a blemish.
quotes.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quotes.quote: Dishonesty is so grasping it would deceive God himself, were it possible.
quotes.author: George Bancroft

quotes.quote: People want to work with somebody who feels shame, who worries about the perceptions of others. Dishonesty is something we don't like in others.
quotes.author: Frans De Waal

quotes.quote: The trouble with lying and deceiving is that their efficiency depends entirely upon a clear notion of the truth that the liar and deceiver wishes to hide.
quotes.author: Hannah Arendt

quotes.quote: Lying can never save us from another lie.
quotes.author: Vaclav Havel

quotes.quote: Lying is done with words and also with silence.
quotes.author: Adrienne Rich

quotes.quote: Dishonesty in a woman is a thing you never blame deeply.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.quote: Dishonesty is the raw material not of quacks only, but also in great part of dupes.
quotes.author: Thomas Carlyle

quotes.quote: Hatred of dishonesty generally arises from fear of being deceived.
quotes.author: Luc De Clapiers

quotes.quote: Lying is the greatest of all sins.
quotes.author: Alfred Nobel

quotes.quote: Lying is not only saying what isn't true. It is also, in fact especially, saying more than is true and, in the case of the human heart, saying more than one feels. We all do it, every day, to make life simpler.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: The thing about lying is, it is quite exhausting - you have to remember a lot.
quotes.author: Rupert Everett

quotes.quote: Lying is an elementary means of self-defense.
quotes.author: Susan Sontag

quotes.quote: Lying about anything is the cruelest thing in the world you could ever do. Be who you are. Don't try to be someone you're not. It never works.
quotes.author: Summer Glau

quotes.quote: Falsehood is a perennial spring.
quotes.author: Edmund Burke

quotes.quote: When being dishonest, people can still tell the truth. Be mindful of the treacherous that do not lie.
quotes.author: Eric Parslow

quotes.quote: Lying is the only art form that the public sanctions and instinctively prefers to reality.
quotes.author: Jean Cocteau

quotes.quote: It is not only by dint of lying to others, but also of lying to ourselves, that we cease to notice that we are lying.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.quote: Falsehood is invariably the child of fear in one form or another.
quotes.author: Aleister Crowley

quotes.quote: Lying is a terrible vice, it testifies that one despises God, but fears men.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.quote: Whoever is detected in a shameful fraud is ever after not believed even if they speak the truth.
quotes.author: Phaedrus

quotes.quote: Lying is like alcoholism. You are always recovering.
quotes.author: Steven Soderbergh

quotes.quote: The art of using deceit and cunning grow continually weaker and less effective to the user.
quotes.author: John Tillotson

quotes.quote: Lying is not only a defense mechanism; it's also a coping mechanism and a survival technique.
quotes.author: Monica Raymund

quotes.quote: There's something different about looking someone in the eyes and doing something dishonest to doing it over the phone or screen.
quotes.author: Justin Welby

quotes.quote: Lying is a sin destructive to society; for there is no trade where there is no trust, and there is no trust where there is no truth.
quotes.author: Wellins Calcott

quotes.quote: The worst kind of lying I've ever done is keeping things from people.
quotes.author: Elijah Wood

quotes.quote: The deception of others is almost always rooted in the deception of ourselves.
quotes.author: Bill W

quotes.quote: Being dishonest to himself is the biggest crime any human can make
quotes.author: Loknath

quotes.quote: Lying increases the creative faculties, expands the ego, and lessens the frictions of social contacts.
quotes.author: Clare Boothe Luce

quotes.quote: Saying what you believe others want to hear is, of course, a form of lying.
quotes.author: Karl Ove Knausgard

quotes.quote: Lying does exist in crazy forms.
quotes.author: Chris Pine

quotes.quote: There are people who exaggerate so much that they can't tell the truth without lying.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: ''They say'' is often a great liar.
quotes.author: Proverb

quotes.quote: Lying, the telling of beautiful untrue things, is the proper aim of Art.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Lying is an indispensable part of making life tolerable.
quotes.author: Evans

quotes.quote: Exaggeration is a blood relation to falsehood and nearly as blamable.
quotes.author: Hosea Ballou

quotes.quote: It is an affront to treat falsehood with complaisance.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.quote: Deceit is the game of petty spirits, and that is by nature a woman's quality.
quotes.author: Pierre Corneille

quotes.quote: There's a degree of deception in silence.
quotes.author: Don Lemon

quotes.quote: All deception in the course of life is indeed nothing else but a lie reduced to practice, and falsehood passing from words into things.
quotes.author: Robert Southey

quotes.quote: Deception may give us what we want for the present, but it will always take it away in the end.
quotes.author: Rachel Hawthorne

quotes.quote: For the most part fraud in the end secures for its companions repentance and shame.
quotes.author: Charles Simmons

quotes.quote: To pretend to know when you do not know is a disease.
quotes.author: Lao-Tzu

quotes.quote: False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: He who indulges in falsehood will find the paths of paradise shut to him.
quotes.author: Abu Bakr

quotes.quote: A divine falsehood is more powerful than any human truth.
quotes.author: Mikhail Bakunin

quotes.quote: Falsehood is the jockey of misfortune.
quotes.author: Jean Giraudoux

quotes.quote: Falsehood always endeavors to copy the mien and attitude of truth.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: It is a true saying that One falsehood leads easily to another.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Dishonesty is a forsaking of permanent for temporary advantages.
quotes.author: Bovee.

quotes.quote: He who purposely cheats his friend would cheat his God.
quotes.author: Lavater

quotes.quote: I could never draw the line between meanness and dishonesty. What is mean, so far I can see, slides by indistinguishable gradations into what is dishonest.
quotes.author: C. Macdonald

quotes.quote: Every man takes care that his neighbor shall not cheat him. But a day comes when he begins to care that he does not cheat his neighbor. Then all goes well. he has changed his market-cart into a chariot of the sun.
quotes.author: Emerson

quotes.quote: Prefer loss to the wealth of dishonest gain; the former vexes you for a time; the latter will bring long-lasting remorse.
quotes.author: Chilo

quotes.quote: If you want to keep a man honest, never call him a liar.
quotes.author: Clark Gable

quotes.quote: All women are dishonest. If they weren't, the world would be divided into two classes of people: old maids and bachelors.
quotes.author: Helen Broderick

quotes.quote: I have known a vast quantity of nonsense talked about bad men not looking you in the face. Don't trust that conventional idea. Dishonesty will stare honesty out of countenance, any day in the week if there is anything to be got by it.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.quote: Dishonesty, cowardice, and duplicity are never impulsive.
quotes.author: George Knight

quotes.quote: Even a secret agent can't lie to a Jewish mother.
quotes.author: Peter Malkin

quotes.quote: Men are so simple and yield so readily to the wants of the moment that he who will trick will always find another who will suffer himself to be tricked.
quotes.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quotes.quote: If a man deceives me once, shame on him; if he deceives me twice, shame on me.
quotes.author: Japanese Proverb

quotes.quote: May the man be damned and never grow fat, who wears two faces under one hat.
quotes.author: Spanish Proverb

quotes.quote: Bread gained by deceit is sweet but afterward, the mouth will be full of gravel.
quotes.author: Proverbs 20:17

quotes.quote: The thoughts of the righteous are right; the counsels of the wicked are deceit.
quotes.author: Proverbs 12:5

quotes.quote: You can fool some of the people all of the time, and all of the people some of the time, but you cannot fool all of the people all of the time.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: indeed, it is not in human nature to deceive others for any long time, without in a measure deceiving ourselves, too.
quotes.author: John Henry Newman

quotes.quote: A poor man is better than a liar.
quotes.author: Proverbs 19:22

quotes.quote: No man was ever so much deceived by another as by himself.
quotes.author: Greville

quotes.quote: Deceit is the false road to happiness; and all the joys we travel through to vice, like fairy banquets, vanish when we touch them.
quotes.author: A. Hill

quotes.quote: The first and worst of all frauds is to cheat one's self— All sin is easy after that.
quotes.author: Bailey

quotes.quote: O, what a tangled web we weave, when first we practice to deceive.
quotes.author: Walter Scott

quotes.quote: Were we to take as much pains to be what we ought, as we do to disguise what we are, we might appear like ourselves without being at the trouble of any disguise at all.
quotes.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: One deceit needs many others, and so the whole house is built in the air and must soon come to the ground.
quotes.author: Baltasar Gracian

quotes.quote: Everything that deceives may be said to enchant.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: When I consider life, 'tis all a cheat; / Yet, fooled with hope, men favor the deceit; / Trust on and think tomorrow will repay, / Tomorrow's falser than the former day.
quotes.author: John Dryden

quotes.quote: A liar begins with making falsehood appear like truth, and ends with making truth itself appear like falsehood.
quotes.author: Shenstone

quotes.quote: Falsehood, like the dry rot, flourishes the more in proportion as air and light are excluded.
quotes.author: Whately

quotes.quote: The telling of falsehood is like the cut of a saber; for though the wound may heal, the scar of it will remain.
quotes.author: Saadi

quotes.quote: Falsehoods not only disagree with truths but usually quarrel among themselves.
quotes.author: Daniel Webster

quotes.quote: No one is so completely disenchanted with the world, or knows it so thoroughly, or is so utterly disgusted with it, that when it begins to smile upon him he does not become partially reconciled to it.
quotes.author: Giacomo Leopardi

quotes.quote: Wisdom comes by disillusionment.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.quote: Disillusion comes only to the illusioned. One cannot be disillusioned of what one never put faith in.
quotes.author: Dorothy Thompson

quotes.quote: The reason why we are disenchanted with ourselves is because we entertain in the depths of our psyche a kind of vision-an anticipated vision of what we could be if we would be what we might be.
quotes.author: Vilayat Inayat Khan

quotes.quote: God is not disillusioned with us. He never had any illusions to begin with.
quotes.author: Luis Palau

quotes.quote: Disillusioned, people simply carried out their work as intended, drinking away sobriety at the end of each hard shift and repeating the process until death.
quotes.author: Christopher Byford

quotes.quote: Living in an age of advertisement, we are perpetually disillusioned. The perfect life is spread before us every day, but it changes and withers at a touch.
quotes.author: J. B. Priestley

quotes.quote: Disillusionment in living is finding that no one can really ever be agreeing with you completely in anything.
quotes.author: Gertrude Stein

quotes.quote: When one illusion doesn't work then we become disillusioned and we go around with our antennae up looking for another illusion.
quotes.author: Anam Thubten

quotes.quote: Scratch any cynic and you will find a disappointed idealist.
quotes.author: George Carlin

quotes.quote: We can destroy ourselves by cynicism and disillusion, just as effectively as by bombs.
quotes.author: Kenneth Clark

quotes.quote: Beauty without intelligence is an illusion that is close to disenchantment. It is like a fairy that fascinates us, as long as we look at her through the enchanting prism of her beauty. However, it disappears as soon as the light of reason penetrates beyond the place where the eyes can see.
quotes.author: Mercedes Cabello de Carbonera

quotes.quote: Sons have always a rebellious wish to be disillusioned by that which charmed their fathers.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: Disenchantment, whether it is a minor disappointment or a major shock, is the signal that things are moving into transition in our lives.
quotes.author: William Throsby Bridges

quotes.quote: Personal disillusionment accompanied by self-pity and self-loathing are the Achilles' heel of modern humankind, representing the weakness of the human spirit.
quotes.author: Kilroy J. Oldster

quotes.quote: It is impossible to read the daily press without being diverted from reality. You are full of enthusiasm for the eternal verities-life is worth living, and then out of sinful curiosity you open a newspaper. You are disillusioned and wrecked.
quotes.author: Patrick Kavanaugh

quotes.quote: The fate of our times is characterized by rationalization and intellectualization and, above all, by the disenchantment of the world.
quotes.author: Max Weber

quotes.quote: The challenge of modernity is to live without illusions and without becoming disillusioned.
quotes.author: Antonio Gramsci

quotes.quote: False beliefs can be every bit as consoling as true ones, right up until the moment of disillusionment.
quotes.author: Richard Dawkins

quotes.quote: It is dangerous to let the public behind the scenes. They are easily disillusioned and then they are angry with you, for it was the illusion they loved.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: Disillusionment means having no more misconceptions, false impressions, and false judgments in life; it means being free from these deceptions. Refusing to be disillusioned is the cause of much of the suffering of human life.
quotes.author: Oswald Chambers

quotes.quote: It is not true that people stop pursuing dreams because they grow old, they grow old because they stop pursuing dreams.
quotes.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quotes.quote: Disillusioned words like bullets bark as human gods aim for their mark.
quotes.author: Bob Dylan

quotes.quote: To be poor, ugly and, moreover, intelligent condemns one in our society to a dark and disillusioned life...to beauty all is forgiven.
quotes.author: Muriel Barbery

quotes.quote: A child who is disillusioned abruptly, by his peers or siblings, being ridiculed for his faith and imagination, may choose never to believe in anything- tangible or intangible- again. To never trust or wonder.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.quote: Our greatest illusion is disillusion. We imagine that we are disillusioned with life, when the truth is that we have not even begun to live.
quotes.author: Paul Brunton

quotes.quote: Experience proves that none is so cruel as the disillusioned sentimentalist.
quotes.author: W.R. Inge

quotes.quote: Look into the interior of things. Things are generally other than they seem, and ignorance that never looks beneath the rind is disillusioned when you show the kernel.
quotes.author: Baltasar Gracian

quotes.quote: Death from disillusion is not instantaneous, and there are no mercy killers for the disillusioned.
quotes.author: Anais Nin

quotes.quote: We can be of little service to our fellows until we become disillusioned without being embittered.
quotes.author: Lord Darling

quotes.quote: What really frightens and dismays us is not external events themselves, but the way in which we think about them. It is not things that disturb us, but our interpretation of their significance.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: There is no mistaking the dismay on the face of a writer who has just heard that his brain child is a deformed idiot.
quotes.author: L. Sprague de Camp

quotes.quote: Don't be dismayed by good-byes. A farewell is necessary before you can meet again. And meeting again, after moments or lifetimes, is certain for those who are friends.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.quote: Do not take yourself too seriously. You have to learn not to be dismayed at making mistakes. No human being can avoid failures.
quotes.author: Lawrence G. Lovasik

quotes.quote: Disappoint anyone... hell, disappoint everyone — but don't ever disappoint yourself.
quotes.author: Treat Williams

quotes.quote: When people disappoint you, it's just as much your responsibility to be aware of it and what you don't want.
quotes.author: Angel Olsen

quotes.quote: You may have to disappoint some people in order to be true to yourself. That's OK. Their disappointment has nothing to do with you.
quotes.author: Shira Tamir

quotes.quote: Our disappointment sits between us.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.quote: Hurts and disappointments can hold gifts.
quotes.author: Eleanor Brown

quotes.quote: Depression begins with disappointment. When disappointment festers in our soul, it leads to discouragement.
quotes.author: Joyce Meyer

quotes.quote: Disappointment is the nurse of wisdom.
quotes.author: Bayle Roche

quotes.quote: Disappointment is often the salt of life.
quotes.author: Theodore Parker

quotes.quote: How disappointment tracks the steps of hope.
quotes.author: Letitia Elizabeth Landon

quotes.quote: Disappointment tears the bearable film of life.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Bowen

quotes.quote: Disappointment results from the removal of illusion.
quotes.author: Chogyam Trungpa

quotes.quote: Some disappointment is always the price of brave dreaming.
quotes.author: Robin S. Sharma

quotes.quote: Disappointments are inevitable; discouragement is a choice.
quotes.author: Charles Stanley

quotes.quote: There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.quote: Disappointment is an endless wellspring of comedy inspiration.
quotes.author: Martin Freeman

quotes.quote: In the midst of the disappointment, we find faith as an anchor!
quotes.author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quotes.quote: Disappointments are to the soul what a thunderstorm is to the air.
quotes.author: Friedrich Schiller

quotes.quote: Disappointment is simply a dream that doesnt want to become a reality.
quotes.author: Richard Wilkins

quotes.quote: Take the high road. No matter how much strife, and consternation, frustration and anger you might be confronted with - don't go to that level.
quotes.author: Tim Gunn

quotes.quote: If you can survive disappointment, nothing can beat you.
quotes.author: Louis C. K.

quotes.quote: A father's disappointment can be a very powerful tool.
quotes.author: Michael Bergin

quotes.quote: We express disappointment in everything except ourselves.
quotes.author: Mason Cooley

quotes.quote: The greatest disappointment is when you let yourself down.
quotes.author: Jenny Holzer

quotes.quote: Life has too many disappointments to make room for negativity.
quotes.author: Daniel Willey

quotes.quote: Disappointment has quite a penchant for taking one by a surprise.
quotes.author: Pawan Mishra

quotes.quote: Disappointment is the gap that exists between expectation and reality.
quotes.author: John C. Maxwell

quotes.quote: Disappointment proves that expectations were mistaken.
quotes.author: Mason Cooley

quotes.quote: Sometimes your disappointments make you a stronger person for the future.
quotes.author: Blanka Vlasic

quotes.quote: You can only kill disappointment with a new try.
quotes.author: Kim Stanley Robinson

quotes.quote: Disappointment can drive us, or it can defeat us.
quotes.author: Anthony Robbins

quotes.quote: Disappointment requires adequate planning.
quotes.author: Richard Bandler

quotes.quote: I will try to disappoint you better than anyone else has.
quotes.author: Stephen Dunn

quotes.quote: When the darkness of dismay comes, endure until it is over, because out of it will come that following of Jesus which is an unspeakable joy.
quotes.author: Oswald Chambers

quotes.quote: Not wanting to disappoint is what pushed me to be successful.
quotes.author: Jerry Rice

quotes.quote: It fills me with dismay sometimes when you look at the scripts that do come to you that are primarily focused on violence. There are so many other things to play around with.
quotes.author: Richard C. Armitage

quotes.quote: Disneyland is the star, everything else is in the supporting role.
quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.quote: Disneyland is presented as imaginary in order to make us believe that the rest is real.
quotes.author: Jean Baudrillard

quotes.quote: Disneyland will never be completed. It will continue to grow as long as there is imagination left in the world.
quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.quote: Adventure without risk is Disneyland.
quotes.author: Douglas Coupland

quotes.quote: Disneyland. The world's biggest people trap, built by a mouse.
quotes.author: Bill Murray

quotes.quote: At Disneyland, you never go backstage - even when youre in the bathroom.
quotes.author: Hideo Kojima

quotes.quote: The magic of Disneyland, walking through the tunnel underneath the train station to Main Street, it just transports you to other places and other times.
quotes.author: John Lasseter

quotes.quote: Disneyland is like Alice stepping through the Looking Glass; to step through the portals of Disneyland will be like entering another world.
quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.quote: The park achieved a kind of reality. Like these virtual reality games the children are playing with. I told them we were doing this 40 years ago! Disneyland is virtual reality.
quotes.author: John Hench

quotes.quote: Disneyland is often called a magic kingdom because it combines fantasy and history, adventure and learning, together with every variety of recreation and fun designed to appeal to everyone.
quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.quote: Disneyland is Vegas for children.
quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.quote: It gets a little crazy at Disneyland. It's a little bit more hardcore then people think.
quotes.author: Aja Naomi King

quotes.quote: Disneyland will always be building and growing and adding new things... new ways of having fun, of learning things, and sharing the many exciting adventures which may be experienced here in the company of family and friends.
quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.quote: Disneyland is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created America.
quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.quote: The idea of Disneyland is a simple one. It will be a place for people to find happiness and knowledge.
quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.quote: We love to entertain kings and queens, but at Disneyland, everyone is a V.I.P.
quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.quote: When you go to the park, there is no horizon - just Disneyland.
quotes.author: John Hench

quotes.quote: When you're a kid and you go to Disneyland or Disneyworld and you're so pumped and then you go when you're grown up and it's not as much fun as you remember it.
quotes.author: Michelle Chamuel

quotes.quote: Disneyland: The only place in the world where we can all be children.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Disobedience is man's original virtue.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Disobedience is the stamp of the hero.
quotes.author: Arthur Desmond

quotes.quote: Disobedience is the vehicle of progress.
quotes.author: John McAfee

quotes.quote: The secret of all failure is disobedience.
quotes.author: Mary Slessor

quotes.quote: Disobedience to conscience makes conscience blind.
quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

quotes.quote: Civil disobedience is the inherent right of a citizen.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: Civil disobedience is a preparation for mute suffering.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: Disobedience to be civil has to be open and nonviolent.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: Civil disobedience can only lead to strength and purity.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: When you know how to use it, disobedience can be a virtue.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.quote: Any lack of joy in the world is the result of disobedience.
quotes.author: Carolyn Shields

quotes.quote: Accepting yourself as you are is an act of civil disobedience.
quotes.author: Francesca Martinez

quotes.quote: Disobedience that is wholly civil should never provoke retaliation.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: Obedience is an act of faith; disobedience is the result of unbelief.
quotes.author: Edwin Louis Cole
